1591 if( i.id == cbm_id ) {
1592 if( !i.powered ) {
1593 return activate_bionic( index, eff_only );
1594 } else {
1595 return false;
1596 }
1597 }
1598 index += 1;
1599 }
1600 return false;
1601}

◆ address_needs() [2/2]

npc_action npc::address_needs ( float  danger)

Definition at line 1792 of file npcmove.cpp.

1793{
1794 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
1795 // rng because NPCs are not meant to be hypervigilant hawks that notice everything
1796 // and swing into action with alarming alacrity.
1797 // no sometimes they are just looking the other way, sometimes they hestitate.
1798 // ( also we can get huge performance boosts )
1799 if( one_in( 3 ) ) {
1800 healing_options try_to_fix_me = patient_assessment( *this );
1801 if( try_to_fix_me.any_true() ) {
1802 if( !use_bionic_by_id( bio_nanobots ) ) {
1803 ai_cache.can_heal = has_healing_options( try_to_fix_me );
1804 if( ai_cache.can_heal.any_true() ) {
1805 return npc_heal;
1806 }
1807 }
1808 } else {
1809 deactivate_bionic_by_id( bio_nanobots );
1810 }
1811 if( get_skill_level( skill_firstaid ) > 0 ) {
1812 if( is_player_ally() ) {
1813 healing_options try_to_fix_other = patient_assessment( player_character );
1814 if( try_to_fix_other.any_true() ) {
1815 ai_cache.can_heal = has_healing_options( try_to_fix_other );
1816 if( ai_cache.can_heal.any_true() ) {
1817 ai_cache.ally = g->shared_from( player_character );
1818 return npc_heal_player;
1819 }
1820 }
1821 }
1822 for( const npc &guy : g->all_npcs() ) {
1823 if( &guy == this || !guy.is_ally( *this ) || guy.posz() != posz() || !sees( guy ) ) {
1824 continue;
1825 }
1826 healing_options try_to_fix_other = patient_assessment( guy );
1827 if( try_to_fix_other.any_true() ) {
1828 ai_cache.can_heal = has_healing_options( try_to_fix_other );
1829 if( ai_cache.can_heal.any_true() ) {
1830 ai_cache.ally = g->shared_from( guy );
1831 return npc_heal_player;
1832 }
1833 }
1834 }
1835 }
1836 }
1837
1838 if( one_in( 3 ) ) {
1839 if( get_perceived_pain() >= 15 ) {
1840 if( !activate_bionic_by_id( bio_painkiller ) && has_painkiller() && !took_painkiller() ) {
1841 return npc_use_painkiller;
1842 }
1843 } else {
1844 deactivate_bionic_by_id( bio_painkiller );
1845 }
1846 }
1847
1848 if( one_in( 3 ) && can_reload_current() ) {
1849 return npc_reload;
1850 }
1851
1852 item &reloadable = find_reloadable();
1853 if( !reloadable.is_null() ) {
1854 do_reload( reloadable );
1855 return npc_noop;
1856 }
1857
1858 // Extreme thirst or hunger, bypass safety check.
1859 if( get_thirst() > thirst_levels::dehydrated ||
1860 get_stored_kcal() + stomach.get_calories() < max_stored_kcal() * 0.75 ) {
1861 if( consume_food_from_camp() ) {
1862 return npc_noop;
1863 }
1864 if( consume_food() ) {
1865 return npc_noop;
1866 }
1867 }
1868 //Does the hallucination needs to disappear ?
1869 if( is_hallucination() && player_character.sees( *this ) ) {
1870 if( !player_character.has_effect( effect_hallu ) ) {
1871 die( nullptr );
1872 }
1873 }
1874
1875 if( danger > NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW ) {
1876 return npc_undecided;
1877 }
1878
1879 if( one_in( 3 ) && ( get_thirst() > thirst_levels::thirsty ||
1880 get_stored_kcal() + stomach.get_calories() < max_stored_kcal() * 0.95 ) ) {
1881 if( consume_food_from_camp() ) {
1882 return npc_noop;
1883 }
1884 if( consume_food() ) {
1885 return npc_noop;
1886 }
1887 }
1888
1889 if( one_in( 3 ) && wants_to_recharge_cbm() && recharge_cbm() ) {
1890 return npc_noop;
1891 }
1892
1893 if( one_in( 3 ) && find_corpse_to_pulp() ) {
1894 if( !do_pulp() ) {
1895 move_to_next();
1896 }
1897 return npc_noop;
1898 }
1899
1900 if( one_in( 3 ) && adjust_worn() ) {
1901 return npc_noop;
1902 }
1903
1904 const auto could_sleep = [&]() {
1905 if( danger <= 0.01 ) {
1906 if( get_fatigue() >= fatigue_levels::tired ) {
1907 return true;
1908 } else if( is_walking_with() && player_character.in_sleep_state() &&
1909 get_fatigue() > ( fatigue_levels::tired / 2 ) ) {
1910 return true;
1911 }
1912 }
1913 return false;
1914 };
1915 // TODO: More risky attempts at sleep when exhausted
1916 if( one_in( 3 ) && could_sleep() ) {
1917 if( !is_player_ally() ) {
1918 // TODO: Make tired NPCs handle sleep offscreen
1919 set_fatigue( 0 );
1920 return npc_undecided;
1921 }
1922
1923 if( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::allow_sleep ) || get_fatigue() > fatigue_levels::massive ) {
1924 return npc_sleep;
1925 } else if( player_character.in_sleep_state() ) {
1926 // TODO: "Guard me while I sleep" command
1927 return npc_sleep;
1928 }
1929 }
1930 // TODO: Mutation & trait related needs
1931 // e.g. finding glasses; getting out of sunlight if we're an albino; etc.
1932
1933 return npc_undecided;
1934}

◆ address_player()

npc_action npc::address_player ( )

Definition at line 1936 of file npcmove.cpp.

1937{
1938 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
1939 if( ( attitude == NPCATT_TALK ) && sees( player_character ) ) {
1940 if( player_character.in_sleep_state() ) {
1941 // Leave sleeping characters alone.
1942 return npc_undecided;
1943 }
1944 if( rl_dist( pos(), player_character.pos() ) <= 6 ) {
1945 return npc_talk_to_player; // Close enough to talk to you
1946 } else {
1947 if( one_in( 10 ) ) {
1948 say( "<lets_talk>" );
1949 }
1950 return npc_follow_player;
1951 }
1952 }
1953
1954 if( attitude == NPCATT_MUG && sees( player_character ) ) {
1955 if( one_in( 3 ) ) {
1956 say( _( "Don't move a <swear> muscle" ) );
1957 }
1958 return npc_mug_player;
1959 }
1960
1961 if( attitude == NPCATT_WAIT_FOR_LEAVE ) {
1962 patience--;
1963 if( patience <= 0 ) {
1964 patience = 0;
1965 set_attitude( NPCATT_KILL );
1966 return npc_noop;
1967 }
1968 return npc_undecided;
1969 }
1970
1971 if( attitude == NPCATT_FLEE_TEMP ) {
1972 return npc_flee;
1973 }
1974
1975 if( attitude == NPCATT_LEAD ) {
1976 if( rl_dist( pos(), player_character.pos() ) >= 12 || !sees( player_character ) ) {
1977 int intense = get_effect_int( effect_catch_up );
1978 if( intense < 10 ) {
1979 say( "<keep_up>" );
1980 add_effect( effect_catch_up, 5_turns );
1981 return npc_pause;
1982 } else {
1983 say( "<im_leaving_you>" );
1984 set_attitude( NPCATT_NULL );
1985 return npc_pause;
1986 }
1987 } else if( has_omt_destination() ) {
1988 return npc_goto_destination;
1989 } else { // At goal. Now, waiting on nearby player
1990 return npc_pause;
1991 }
1992 }
1993 return npc_undecided;
1994}

4611 if( is_limb_broken( bp ) ) {
4612 any_broken = true;
4613 break;
4614 }
4615 }
4616
4617 if( !any_broken ) {
4618 return false;
4619 }
4620 const auto covers_broken = [this]( const item & it, side s ) {
4621 const body_part_set covered = it.get_covered_body_parts( s );
4622 for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, bodypart> &elem : get_body() ) {
4623 if( elem.second.get_hp_cur() <= 0 && covered.test( elem.first->token ) ) {
4624 return true;
4625 }
4626 }
4627 return false;
4628 };
4629
4630 for( auto &elem : worn ) {
4631 if( !elem.has_flag( "SPLINT" ) ) {
4632 continue;
4633 }
4634
4635 if( !covers_broken( elem, elem.get_side() ) ) {
4636 const bool needs_change = covers_broken( elem, opposite_side( elem.get_side() ) );
4637 // Try to change side (if it makes sense), or take off.
4638 if( ( needs_change && change_side( elem ) ) || takeoff( elem ) ) {
4639 return true;
4640 }
4641 }
4642 }
4643
4644 return false;

◆ alt_attack()

bool npc::alt_attack ( )

Definition at line 3511 of file npcmove.cpp.

3512{
3513 if( ( is_player_ally() && !rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_grenades ) ) || is_hallucination() ) {
3514 return false;
3515 }
3516
3517 Creature *critter = current_target();
3518 if( critter == nullptr ) {
3519 // This function shouldn't be called...
3520 debugmsg( "npc::alt_attack() called with no target" );
3521 move_pause();
3522 return false;
3523 }
3524
3525 tripoint tar = critter->pos();
3526
3527 const int dist = rl_dist( pos(), tar );
3528 item *used = nullptr;
3529 // Remember if we have an item that is dangerous to hold
3530 bool used_dangerous = false;
3531
3532 static const std::string danger_string( "NPC_THROW_NOW" );
3533 static const std::string alt_string( "NPC_ALT_ATTACK" );
3534 // TODO: The active bomb with shortest fuse should be thrown first
3535 const auto check_alt_item = [&used, &used_dangerous, dist, this]( item & it ) {
3536 const bool dangerous = it.has_flag( danger_string );
3537 if( !dangerous && used_dangerous ) {
3538 return;
3539 }
3540
3541 // Not alt attack
3542 if( !dangerous && !it.has_flag( alt_string ) ) {
3543 return;
3544 }
3545
3546 // TODO: Non-thrown alt items
3547 if( !dangerous && throw_range( it ) < dist ) {
3548 return;
3549 }
3550
3551 // Low priority items
3552 if( !dangerous && used != nullptr ) {
3553 return;
3554 }
3555
3556 used = &it;
3557 used_dangerous = used_dangerous || dangerous;
3558 };
3559
3560 check_alt_item( weapon );
3561 for( auto &sl : inv.slice() ) {
3562 // TODO: Cached values - an itype slot maybe?
3563 check_alt_item( sl->front() );
3564 }
3565
3566 if( used == nullptr ) {
3567 return false;
3568 }
3569
3570 int weapon_index = get_item_position( used );
3571 if( weapon_index == INT_MIN ) {
3572 debugmsg( "npc::alt_attack() couldn't find expected item %s", used->tname() );
3573 return false;
3574 }
3575
3576 // Are we going to throw this item?
3577 if( !used->active && used->has_flag( "NPC_ACTIVATE" ) ) {
3578 activate_item( weapon_index );
3579 // Note: intentional lack of return here
3580 // We want to ignore player-centric rules to avoid carrying live explosives
3581 // TODO: Non-grenades
3582 }
3583
3584 // We are throwing it!
3585 int conf = confident_throw_range( *used, critter );
3586 const bool wont_hit = wont_hit_friend( tar, *used, true );
3587 if( dist <= conf && wont_hit ) {
3588 npc_throw( *this, *used, weapon_index, tar );
3589 return true;
3590 }
3591
3592 if( wont_hit ) {
3593 // Within this block, our chosen target is outside of our range
3594 update_path( tar );
3595 move_to_next(); // Move towards the target
3596 }
3597
3598 // Danger of friendly fire
3599 if( !wont_hit && !used_dangerous ) {
3600 // Safe to hold on to, for now
3601 // Maneuver around player
3602 avoid_friendly_fire();
3603 return true;
3604 }
3605
3606 map &here = get_map();
3607 // We need to throw this live (grenade, etc) NOW! Pick another target?
3608 for( int dist = 2; dist <= conf; dist++ ) {
3609 for( const tripoint &pt : here.points_in_radius( pos(), dist ) ) {
3610 const monster *const target_ptr = g->critter_at<monster>( pt );
3611 int newdist = rl_dist( pos(), pt );
3612 // TODO: Change "newdist >= 2" to "newdist >= safe_distance(used)"
3613 if( newdist <= conf && newdist >= 2 && target_ptr &&
3614 wont_hit_friend( pt, *used, true ) ) {
3615 // Friendlyfire-safe!
3616 ai_cache.target = g->shared_from( *target_ptr );
3617 if( !one_in( 100 ) ) {
3618 // Just to prevent infinite loops...
3619 if( alt_attack() ) {
3620 return true;
3621 }
3622 }
3623 return false;
3624 }
3625 }
3626 }
3627 /* If we have reached THIS point, there's no acceptable monster to throw our
3628 * grenade or whatever at. Since it's about to go off in our hands, better to
3629 * just chuck it as far away as possible--while being friendly-safe.
3630 */
3631 int best_dist = 0;
3632 for( int dist = 2; dist <= conf; dist++ ) {
3633 for( const tripoint &pt : here.points_in_radius( pos(), dist ) ) {
3634 int new_dist = rl_dist( pos(), pt );
3635 if( new_dist > best_dist && wont_hit_friend( pt, *used, true ) ) {
3636 best_dist = new_dist;
3637 tar = pt;
3638 }
3639 }
3640 }
3641 /* Even if tar.x/tar.y didn't get set by the above loop, throw it anyway. They
3642 * should be equal to the original location of our target, and risking friendly
3643 * fire is better than holding on to a live grenade / whatever.
3644 */
3645 npc_throw( *this, *used, weapon_index, tar );
3646 return true;
3647}

◆ assess_danger()

void npc::assess_danger ( )

Definition at line 367 of file npcmove.cpp.

368{
369 float assessment = 0.0f;
370 float highest_priority = 1.0f;
371 int def_radius = rules.has_flag( ally_rule::follow_close ) ? follow_distance() : 6;
372
373 // Radius we can attack without moving
374 int max_range;
375 if( confident_range_cache ) {
376 max_range = *confident_range_cache;
377 } else {
378 invalidate_range_cache();
379 max_range = *confident_range_cache;
380 }
381
382 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
383 const bool self_defense_only = rules.engagement == combat_engagement::NO_MOVE ||
384 rules.engagement == combat_engagement::NONE;
385 const bool no_fighting = rules.has_flag( ally_rule::forbid_engage );
386 const bool must_retreat = is_walking_with() && rules.has_flag( ally_rule::follow_close ) &&
387 !too_close( pos(), player_character.pos(), follow_distance() );
388
389 if( is_player_ally() ) {
390 if( rules.engagement == combat_engagement::FREE_FIRE ) {
391 def_radius = std::max( 6, max_range );
392 } else if( self_defense_only ) {
393 def_radius = max_range;
394 } else if( no_fighting ) {
395 def_radius = 1;
396 }
397 }
398
399 const auto ok_by_rules = [max_range, def_radius, this, &player_character]( const Creature & c,
400 int dist,
401 int scaled_dist ) {
402 // If we're forbidden to attack, no need to check engagement rules
403 if( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::forbid_engage ) ) {
404 return false;
405 }
406 switch( rules.engagement ) {
407 case combat_engagement::NONE:
408 return false;
409 case combat_engagement::CLOSE:
410 // Either close to player or close enough that we can reach it and close to us
411 return ( dist <= max_range && scaled_dist <= def_radius * 0.5 ) ||
412 too_close( c.pos(), player_character.pos(), def_radius );
413 case combat_engagement::WEAK:
414 return c.get_hp() <= average_damage_dealt();
415 case combat_engagement::HIT:
416 return c.has_effect( effect_hit_by_player );
417 case combat_engagement::NO_MOVE:
418 return dist <= max_range;
419 case combat_engagement::FREE_FIRE:
420 return dist <= max_range;
421 case combat_engagement::ALL:
422 return true;
423 }
424
425 return true;
426 };
427 std::map<direction, float> cur_threat_map;
428 // start with a decayed version of last turn's map
429 for( direction threat_dir : npc_threat_dir ) {
430 cur_threat_map[ threat_dir ] = 0.25f * ai_cache.threat_map[ threat_dir ];
431 }
432 map &here = get_map();
433 // first, check if we're about to be consumed by fire
434 // TODO: Use the field cache
435 for( const tripoint &pt : here.points_in_radius( pos(), 6 ) ) {
436 if( pt == pos() || here.has_flag( TFLAG_FIRE_CONTAINER, pt ) ) {
437 continue;
438 }
439 if( here.get_field( pt, fd_fire ) != nullptr ) {
440 int dist = rl_dist( pos(), pt );
441 cur_threat_map[direction_from( pos(), pt )] += 2.0f * ( NPC_DANGER_MAX - dist );
442 if( dist < 3 && !has_effect( effect_npc_fire_bad ) ) {
443 warn_about( "fire_bad", 1_minutes );
444 add_effect( effect_npc_fire_bad, 5_turns );
445 path.clear();
446 }
447 }
448 }
449
450 // find our Character friends and enemies
451 std::vector<weak_ptr_fast<Creature>> hostile_guys;
452 for( const npc &guy : g->all_npcs() ) {
453 if( &guy == this ) {
454 continue;
455 }
456
457 if( has_faction_relationship( guy, npc_factions::watch_your_back ) ) {
458 ai_cache.friends.emplace_back( g->shared_from( guy ) );
459 } else if( attitude_to( guy ) != A_NEUTRAL && sees( guy.pos() ) ) {
460 hostile_guys.emplace_back( g->shared_from( guy ) );
461 }
462 }
463 if( sees( player_character.pos() ) ) {
464 if( is_enemy() ) {
465 hostile_guys.emplace_back( g->shared_from( player_character ) );
466 } else if( is_friendly( player_character ) ) {
467 ai_cache.friends.emplace_back( g->shared_from( player_character ) );
468 }
469 }
470
471 for( const monster &critter : g->all_monsters() ) {
472 auto att = critter.attitude_to( *this );
473 if( att == A_FRIENDLY ) {
474 ai_cache.friends.emplace_back( g->shared_from( critter ) );
475 continue;
476 }
477 if( att != A_HOSTILE && ( critter.friendly || !is_enemy() ) ) {
478 continue;
479 }
480 if( !sees( critter ) ) {
481 continue;
482 }
483 float critter_threat = evaluate_enemy( critter );
484 // warn and consider the odds for distant enemies
485 int dist = rl_dist( pos(), critter.pos() );
486 if( ( is_enemy() || !critter.friendly ) ) {
487 assessment += critter_threat;
488 if( critter_threat > ( 8.0f + personality.bravery + rng( 0, 5 ) ) ) {
489 warn_about( "monster", 10_minutes, critter.type->nname(), dist, critter.pos() );
490 }
491 }
492 if( must_retreat || no_fighting ) {
493 continue;
494 }
495 // ignore targets behind glass even if we can see them
496 if( !clear_shot_reach( pos(), critter.pos(), false ) ) {
497 continue;
498 }
499
500 float scaled_distance = std::max( 1.0f, dist / critter.speed_rating() );
501 float hp_percent = 1.0f - static_cast<float>( critter.get_hp() ) / critter.get_hp_max();
502 float critter_danger = std::max( critter_threat * ( hp_percent * 0.5f + 0.5f ),
503 NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW );
504 ai_cache.total_danger += critter_danger / scaled_distance;
505
506 // don't ignore monsters that are too close or too close to an ally if we can move
507 bool is_too_close = dist <= def_radius;
508 for( const weak_ptr_fast<Creature> &guy : ai_cache.friends ) {
509 if( is_too_close || self_defense_only ) {
510 break;
511 }
512 // HACK: Bit of a dirty hack - sometimes shared_from, returns nullptr or bad weak_ptr for
513 // friendly NPC when the NPC is riding a creature - I don't know why.
514 // so this skips the bad weak_ptrs, but this doesn't functionally change the AI Priority
515 // because the horse the NPC is riding is still in the ai_cache.friends vector,
516 // so either one would count as a friendly for this purpose.
517 if( guy.lock() ) {
518 is_too_close |= too_close( critter.pos(), guy.lock()->pos(), def_radius );
519 }
520 }
521 // ignore distant monsters that our rules prevent us from attacking
522 if( !is_too_close && is_player_ally() && !ok_by_rules( critter, dist, scaled_distance ) ) {
523 continue;
524 }
525 // prioritize the biggest, nearest threats, or the biggest threats that are threatening
526 // us or an ally
527 // critter danger is always at least NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW
528 float priority = std::max( critter_danger - 2.0f * ( scaled_distance - 1.0f ),
529 is_too_close ? critter_danger : 0.0f );
530 cur_threat_map[direction_from( pos(), critter.pos() )] += priority;
531 if( priority > highest_priority ) {
532 highest_priority = priority;
533 ai_cache.target = g->shared_from( critter );
534 ai_cache.danger = critter_danger;
535 }
536 }
537
538 if( assessment == 0.0 && hostile_guys.empty() ) {
539 ai_cache.danger_assessment = assessment;
540 return;
541 }
542 const auto handle_hostile = [&]( const Character & foe, float foe_threat,
543 const std::string & bogey, const std::string & warning ) {
544 int dist = rl_dist( pos(), foe.pos() );
545 if( foe_threat > ( 8.0f + personality.bravery + rng( 0, 5 ) ) ) {
546 warn_about( "monster", 10_minutes, bogey, dist, foe.pos() );
547 }
548
549 int scaled_distance = std::max( 1, ( 100 * dist ) / foe.get_speed() );
550 ai_cache.total_danger += foe_threat / scaled_distance;
551 if( must_retreat || no_fighting ) {
552 return 0.0f;
553 }
554 // ignore targets behind glass even if we can see them
555 if( !clear_shot_reach( pos(), foe.pos(), false ) ) {
556 return 0.0f;
557 }
558 bool is_too_close = dist <= def_radius;
559 for( const weak_ptr_fast<Creature> &guy : ai_cache.friends ) {
560 if( self_defense_only ) {
561 break;
562 }
563 is_too_close |= too_close( foe.pos(), guy.lock()->pos(), def_radius );
564 if( is_too_close ) {
565 break;
566 }
567 }
568
569 if( !is_player_ally() || is_too_close || ok_by_rules( foe, dist, scaled_distance ) ) {
570 float priority = std::max( foe_threat - 2.0f * ( scaled_distance - 1 ),
571 is_too_close ? std::max( foe_threat, NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW ) :
572 0.0f );
573 cur_threat_map[direction_from( pos(), foe.pos() )] += priority;
574 if( priority > highest_priority ) {
575 warn_about( warning, 1_minutes );
576 highest_priority = priority;
577 ai_cache.danger = foe_threat;
578 ai_cache.target = g->shared_from( foe );
579 }
580 }
581 return foe_threat;
582 };
583
584 for( const weak_ptr_fast<Creature> &guy : hostile_guys ) {
585 player *foe = dynamic_cast<player *>( guy.lock().get() );
586 if( foe && foe->is_npc() ) {
587 assessment += handle_hostile( *foe, evaluate_enemy( *foe ), "bandit", "kill_npc" );
588 }
589 }
590
591 for( const weak_ptr_fast<Creature> &guy : ai_cache.friends ) {
592 player *ally = dynamic_cast<player *>( guy.lock().get() );
593 if( !( ally && ally->is_npc() ) ) {
594 continue;
595 }
596 float guy_threat = evaluate_enemy( *ally );
597 float min_danger = assessment >= NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW ? NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW : -10.0f;
598 assessment = std::max( min_danger, assessment - guy_threat * 0.5f );
599 }
600
601 if( sees( player_character.pos() ) ) {
602 // Mod for the player
603 // cap player difficulty at 150
604 float player_diff = evaluate_enemy( player_character );
605 if( is_enemy() ) {
606 assessment += handle_hostile( player_character, player_diff, "maniac", "kill_player" );
607 } else if( is_friendly( player_character ) ) {
608 float min_danger = assessment >= NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW ? NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW : -10.0f;
609 assessment = std::max( min_danger, assessment - player_diff * 0.5f );
610 ai_cache.friends.emplace_back( g->shared_from( player_character ) );
611 }
612 }
613 assessment *= 0.1f;
614 if( !has_effect( effect_npc_run_away ) && !has_effect( effect_npc_fire_bad ) ) {
615 float my_diff = evaluate_enemy( *this );
616 if( ( my_diff * 0.5f + personality.bravery + rng( 0, 10 ) ) < assessment ) {
617 time_duration run_away_for = 5_turns + 1_turns * rng( 0, 5 );
618 warn_about( "run_away", run_away_for );
619 add_effect( effect_npc_run_away, run_away_for );
620 path.clear();
621 }
622 }
623 // update the threat cache
624 for( size_t i = 0; i < 8; i++ ) {
625 direction threat_dir = npc_threat_dir[i];
626 direction dir_right = npc_threat_dir[( i + 1 ) % 8];
627 direction dir_left = npc_threat_dir[( i + 7 ) % 8 ];
628 ai_cache.threat_map[threat_dir] = cur_threat_map[threat_dir] + 0.1f *
629 ( cur_threat_map[dir_right] + cur_threat_map[dir_left] );
630 }
631 if( assessment <= 2.0f ) {
632 assessment = -10.0f + 5.0f * assessment; // Low danger if no monsters around
633 }
634 ai_cache.danger_assessment = assessment;
635}
rng
units::quantity< V, B > rng(const units::quantity< V, B > &min, const units::quantity< V, B > &max)
Definition: artifact.cpp:32

void npc::avoid_friendly_fire ( )

Definition at line 2480 of file npcmove.cpp.

2481{
2482 // TODO: To parameter
2483 const tripoint &tar = current_target()->pos();
2484 // Calculate center of weight of friends and move away from that
2485 tripoint center;
2486 for( const auto &fr : ai_cache.friends ) {
2487 if( shared_ptr_fast<Creature> fr_p = fr.lock() ) {
2488 center += fr_p->pos();
2489 }
2490 }
2491
2492 float friend_count = ai_cache.friends.size();
2493 center.x = std::round( center.x / friend_count );
2494 center.y = std::round( center.y / friend_count );
2495 center.z = std::round( center.z / friend_count );
2496
2497 std::vector<tripoint> candidates = closest_points_first( pos(), 1 );
2498 candidates.erase( candidates.begin() );
2499 std::sort( candidates.begin(), candidates.end(),
2500 [&tar, &center]( const tripoint & l, const tripoint & r ) {
2501 return ( rl_dist( l, tar ) - rl_dist( l, center ) ) <
2502 ( rl_dist( r, tar ) - rl_dist( r, center ) );
2503 } );
2504
2505 for( const auto &pt : candidates ) {
2506 if( can_move_to( pt ) ) {
2507 move_to( pt );
2508 return;
2509 }
2510 }
2511
2512 /* If we're still in the function at this point, maneuvering can't help us. So,
2513 * might as well address some needs.
2514 * We pass a <danger> value of NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW + 1 so that we won't start
2515 * eating food (or, god help us, sleeping).
2516 */
2517 npc_action action = address_needs( NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW + 1 );
2518 if( action == npc_undecided ) {
2519 move_pause();
2520 }
2521 execute_action( action );
2522}

◆ can_read()

bool npc::can_read ( const item &  book,
std::vector< std::string > &  fail_reasons 
)

Definition at line 839 of file npc.cpp.

840{
841 if( !book.is_book() ) {
842 fail_reasons.push_back( string_format( _( "This %s is not good reading material." ),
843 book.tname() ) );
844 return false;
845 }
846 player *pl = dynamic_cast<player *>( this );
847 if( !pl ) {
848 return false;
849 }
850 const auto &type = book.type->book;
851 const skill_id &skill = type->skill;
852 const int skill_level = pl->get_skill_level( skill );
853 if( skill && skill_level < type->req ) {
854 fail_reasons.push_back( string_format( _( "I'm not smart enough to read this book." ) ) );
855 return false;
856 }
857 if( !skill || skill_level >= type->level ) {
858 fail_reasons.push_back( string_format( _( "I won't learn anything from this book." ) ) );
859 return false;
860 }
861
862 // Check for conditions that disqualify us
863 if( type->intel > 0 && has_trait( trait_ILLITERATE ) ) {
864 fail_reasons.emplace_back( _( "I can't read!" ) );
865 } else if( has_trait( trait_HYPEROPIC ) && !worn_with_flag( "FIX_FARSIGHT" ) &&
866 !has_effect( effect_contacts ) && !has_bionic( bio_eye_optic ) ) {
867 fail_reasons.emplace_back( _( "I can't read without my glasses." ) );
868 } else if( !character_funcs::can_see_fine_details( *this ) ) {
869 // Too dark to read only applies if the player can read to himself
870 fail_reasons.emplace_back( _( "It's too dark to read!" ) );
871 return false;
872 }
873 return true;

◆ check_or_use_weapon_cbm()

void npc::check_or_use_weapon_cbm ( const bionic_id &  cbm_id)

Definition at line 462 of file bionics.cpp.

463{
464 // if we're already using a bio_weapon, keep using it
465 if( cbm_weapon_index >= 0 ) {
466 return;
467 }
468 const float allowed_ratio = static_cast<int>( rules.cbm_reserve ) / 100.0f;
469 const units::energy free_power = get_power_level() - get_max_power_level() * allowed_ratio;
470 if( free_power <= 0_J ) {
471 return;
472 }
473
474 int index = 0;
475 bool found = false;
476 for( bionic &i : *my_bionics ) {
477 if( i.id == cbm_id && !i.powered ) {
478 found = true;
479 break;
480 }
481 index += 1;
482 }
483 if( !found ) {
484 return;
485 }
486 bionic &bio = ( *my_bionics )[index];
487
488 if( bio.info().has_flag( flag_BIONIC_GUN ) ) {
489 const item cbm_weapon = item( bio.info().fake_item );
490 bool not_allowed = !rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_guns ) ||
491 ( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_silent ) && !cbm_weapon.is_silent() );
492 if( is_player_ally() && not_allowed ) {
493 return;
494 }
495
496 const int ups_charges = charges_of( itype_UPS );
497 int ammo_count = weapon.ammo_remaining();
498 const int ups_drain = weapon.get_gun_ups_drain();
499 if( ups_drain > 0 ) {
500 ammo_count = std::min( ammo_count, ups_charges / ups_drain );
501 }
502 const int cbm_ammo = free_power / bio.info().power_activate;
503
504 if( weapon_value( weapon, ammo_count ) < weapon_value( cbm_weapon, cbm_ammo ) ) {
505 real_weapon = weapon;
506 weapon = cbm_weapon;
507 cbm_weapon_index = index;
508 }
509 } else if( bio.info().has_flag( flag_BIONIC_WEAPON ) && !weapon.has_flag( flag_NO_UNWIELD ) &&
510 free_power > bio.info().power_activate ) {
511 if( is_armed() ) {
512 stow_item( weapon );
513 }
514 if( get_player_character().sees( pos() ) ) {
515 add_msg( m_info, _( "%s activates their %s." ), disp_name(), bio.info().name );
516 }
517
518 weapon = item( bio.info().fake_item );
519 mod_power_level( -bio.info().power_activate );
520 bio.powered = true;
521 cbm_weapon_index = index;
522 }
523}

◆ complain()

bool npc::complain ( )

Definition at line 4484 of file npcmove.cpp.

4485{
4486 static const std::string infected_string = "infected";
4487 static const std::string fatigue_string = "fatigue";
4488 static const std::string bite_string = "bite";
4489 static const std::string bleed_string = "bleed";
4490 static const std::string radiation_string = "radiation";
4491 static const std::string hunger_string = "hunger";
4492 static const std::string thirst_string = "thirst";
4493
4494 if( !is_player_ally() || !get_player_character().sees( *this ) ) {
4495 return false;
4496 }
4497
4498 // When infected, complain every (4-intensity) hours
4499 // At intensity 3, ignore player wanting us to shut up
4500 if( has_effect( effect_infected ) ) {
4501 body_part bp = bp_affected( *this, effect_infected );
4502 const auto &eff = get_effect( effect_infected, bp );
4503 int intensity = eff.get_intensity();
4504 const std::string speech = string_format( _( "My %s wound is infected" ),
4505 body_part_name( bp ) );
4506 if( complain_about( infected_string, time_duration::from_hours( 4 - intensity ), speech,
4507 intensity >= 3 ) ) {
4508 // Only one complaint per turn
4509 return true;
4510 }
4511 }
4512
4513 // When bitten, complain every hour, but respect restrictions
4514 if( has_effect( effect_bite ) ) {
4515 body_part bp = bp_affected( *this, effect_bite );
4516 const std::string speech = string_format( _( "The bite wound on my %s looks bad." ),
4517 body_part_name( bp ) );
4518 if( complain_about( bite_string, 1_hours, speech ) ) {
4519 return true;
4520 }
4521 }
4522
4523 // When tired, complain every 30 minutes
4524 // If massively tired, ignore restrictions
4525 if( get_fatigue() > fatigue_levels::tired &&
4526 complain_about( fatigue_string, 30_minutes, _( "<yawn>" ),
4527 get_fatigue() > fatigue_levels::massive - 100 ) ) {
4528 return true;
4529 }
4530
4531 // Radiation every 10 minutes
4532 if( get_rad() > 90 ) {
4533 activate_bionic_by_id( bio_radscrubber );
4534 std::string speech = _( "I'm suffering from radiation sickness" );
4535 if( complain_about( radiation_string, 10_minutes, speech, get_rad() > 150 ) ) {
4536 return true;
4537 }
4538 } else if( !get_rad() ) {
4539 deactivate_bionic_by_id( bio_radscrubber );
4540 }
4541
4542 // Hunger every 3-6 hours
4543 // Since NPCs can't starve to death, respect the rules
4544 if( get_kcal_percent() < 0.9 &&
4545 complain_about( hunger_string, std::max( 3_hours,
4546 time_duration::from_minutes( get_kcal_percent() * 60 * 7 ) ), _( "<hungry>" ) ) ) {
4547 return true;
4548 }
4549
4550 // Thirst every 2 hours
4551 // Since NPCs can't dry to death, respect the rules
4552 if( get_thirst() > thirst_levels::very_thirsty &&
4553 complain_about( thirst_string, 2_hours, _( "<thirsty>" ) ) ) {
4554 return true;
4555 }
4556
4557 //Bleeding every 5 minutes
4558 if( has_effect( effect_bleed ) ) {
4559 body_part bp = bp_affected( *this, effect_bleed );
4560 std::string speech = string_format( _( "My %s is bleeding!" ), body_part_name( bp ) );
4561 if( complain_about( bleed_string, 5_minutes, speech ) ) {
4562 return true;
4563 }
4564 }
4565
4566 return false;
4567}

Definition at line 4453 of file npcmove.cpp.

4455{
4456 // Don't have a default constructor for time_point, so accessing it in the
4457 // complaints map is a bit difficult, those lambdas should cover it.
4458 const auto complain_since = [this]( const std::string & key, const time_duration & d ) {
4459 const auto iter = complaints.find( key );
4460 return iter == complaints.end() || iter->second < calendar::turn - d;
4461 };
4462 const auto set_complain_since = [this]( const std::string & key ) {
4463 const auto iter = complaints.find( key );
4464 if( iter == complaints.end() ) {
4465 complaints.emplace( key, calendar::turn );
4466 } else {
4467 iter->second = calendar::turn;
4468 }
4469 };
4470
4471 // Don't wake player up with non-serious complaints
4472 // Stop complaining while asleep
4473 const bool do_complain = force || ( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::allow_complain ) &&
4474 !get_player_character().in_sleep_state() && !in_sleep_state() );
4475
4476 if( complain_since( issue, dur ) && do_complain ) {
4477 say( speech, priority );
4478 set_complain_since( issue );
4479 return true;
4480 }
4481 return false;
4482}

◆ consume_cbm_items()

bool npc::consume_cbm_items ( const std::function< bool(const item &)> &  filter)

Definition at line 1658 of file npcmove.cpp.

1659{
1660 invslice slice = inv.slice();
1661 int index = -1;
1662 for( size_t i = 0; i < slice.size(); i++ ) {
1663 const item &it = slice[i]->front();
1664 const item &real_item = it.is_container() ? it.contents.front() : it;

1669 }
1670 if( index < 0 ) {
1671 return false;
1672 }
1673 int old_moves = moves;
1674 item_location loc = item_location( *this, &i_at( index ) );
1675 return consume( loc ) && old_moves != moves;
1676}

bool npc::consume_food ( )

3886{
3887 float best_weight = 0.0f;
3888 int index = -1;
3889 int want_hunger = std::max<int>( 0, ( max_stored_kcal() - get_stored_kcal() ) / 10 );
3890 int want_quench = std::max( 0, get_thirst() );
3891 invslice slice = inv.slice();
3892 for( size_t i = 0; i < slice.size(); i++ ) {
3893 const item &it = slice[i]->front();
3894 if( const item *food_item = it.get_food() ) {
3895 float cur_weight = rate_food( *food_item, want_hunger, want_quench );
3896 // Note: will_eat is expensive, avoid calling it if possible
3897 if( cur_weight > best_weight && will_eat( *food_item ).success() ) {
3898 best_weight = cur_weight;
3899 index = i;
3900 }
3901 }
3902 }
3903
3904 if( index == -1 ) {
3905 if( !is_player_ally() ) {
3906 // TODO: Remove this and let player "exploit" hungry NPCs
3907 set_stored_kcal( max_stored_kcal() );
3908 set_thirst( 0 );
3909 }
3910 return false;
3911 }
3912
3913 // consume doesn't return a meaningful answer, we need to compare moves
3914 // TODO: Make player::consume return false if it fails to consume
3915 int old_moves = moves;
3916 item_location loc = item_location( *this, &i_at( index ) );
3917 bool consumed = consume( loc ) && old_moves != moves;
3918 if( !consumed ) {
3919 debugmsg( "%s failed to consume %s", name, i_at( index ).tname() );
3920 }
3921
3922 return consumed;

void npc::decide_needs ( )

1487{
1488 double needrank[num_needs];
1489 for( auto &elem : needrank ) {
1490 elem = 20;
1491 }
1492 if( weapon.is_gun() ) {
1493 int ups_drain = weapon.get_gun_ups_drain();
1494 if( ups_drain > 0 ) {
1495 int ups_charges = charges_of( itype_UPS_off, ups_drain ) +
1496 charges_of( itype_UPS_off, ups_drain );
1497 needrank[need_ammo] = static_cast<double>( ups_charges ) / ups_drain;
1498 } else {
1499 needrank[need_ammo] = get_ammo( ammotype( *weapon.type->gun->ammo.begin() ) ).size();
1500 }
1501 needrank[need_ammo] *= 5;
1502 }
1503 if( !base_location ) {
1504 needrank[need_safety] = 1;
1505 }
1506
1507 needrank[need_weapon] = weapon_value( weapon );
1508 needrank[need_food] = 15.0f - ( max_stored_kcal() - get_stored_kcal() ) / 10.0f;
1509 needrank[need_drink] = 15 - get_thirst();
1510 invslice slice = inv.slice();
1511 for( auto &i : slice ) {
1512 item inventory_item = i->front();
1513 if( const item *food = inventory_item.get_food() ) {
1514 needrank[ need_food ] += nutrition_for( *food ) / 4.0;
1515 needrank[ need_drink ] += food->get_comestible()->quench / 4.0;
1516 }
1517 }
1518 needs.clear();
1519 size_t j;
1520 bool serious = false;
1521 for( int i = 1; i < num_needs; i++ ) {
1522 if( needrank[i] < 10 ) {
1523 serious = true;
1524 }
1525 }
1526 if( !serious ) {
1527 needs.push_back( need_none );
1528 needrank[0] = 10;
1529 }
1530 for( int i = 1; i < num_needs; i++ ) {
1531 if( needrank[i] < 20 ) {
1532 for( j = 0; j < needs.size(); j++ ) {
1533 if( needrank[i] < needrank[needs[j]] ) {
1534 needs.insert( needs.begin() + j, static_cast<npc_need>( i ) );
1535 j = needs.size() + 1;
1536 }
1537 }
1538 if( j == needs.size() ) {
1539 needs.push_back( static_cast<npc_need>( i ) );
1540 }
1541 }
1542 }
1543}

)

2759 };
2760
2761 std::vector<dispose_option> opts;
2762

2778 inv.add_item_keep_invlet( *obj );
2779 obj.remove_item();
2780 inv.unsort();
2781 }
2782 } );
2783 }
2784
2785 if( opts.empty() ) {
2786 // Drop it
2787 g->m.add_item_or_charges( pos(), *obj );
2788 obj.remove_item();
2789 return true;
2790 }
2791
2792 const auto mn = std::min_element( opts.begin(), opts.end(),
2793 []( const dispose_option & lop, const dispose_option & rop ) {
2794 return lop.moves < rop.moves;
2795 } );
2796
2797 mn->action();
2798 return true;
2799}

◆ do_player_activity()

bool npc::do_player_activity ( )

perform a player activity, returning true if it took up the turn

Definition at line 3351 of file npcmove.cpp.

3352{
3353 int old_moves = moves;
3354 if( moves > 200 && activity && ( activity.is_multi_type() ||
3355 activity.id() == activity_id( "ACT_TIDY_UP" ) ) ) {
3356 // a huge backlog of a multi-activity type can forever loop
3357 // instead; just scan the map ONCE for a task to do, and if it returns false
3358 // then stop scanning, abandon the activity, and kill the backlog of moves.
3359 if( !generic_multi_activity_handler( activity, *this->as_player(), true ) ) {
3360 revert_after_activity();
3361 set_moves( 0 );
3362 return true;
3363 }
3364 }
3365 // the multi-activity types can sometimes cancel the activity, and return without using up any moves.
3366 // ( when they are setting a destination etc. )
3367 // normally this isn't a problem, but in the main game loop, if the NPC has a huge backlog of moves;
3368 // then each of these occurrences will nudge the infinite loop counter up by one.
3369 // ( even if other move-using things occur inbetween )
3370 // so here - if no moves are used in a multi-type activity do_turn(), then subtract a nominal amount
3371 // to satisfy the infinite loop counter.
3372 const bool multi_type = activity ? activity.is_multi_type() : false;
3373 const int moves_before = moves;
3374 while( moves > 0 && activity ) {
3375 activity.do_turn( *this );
3376 if( !is_active() ) {
3377 return true;
3378 }
3379 }
3380 if( multi_type && moves == moves_before ) {
3381 moves -= 1;
3382 }
3383 /* if the activity is finished, grab any backlog or change the mission */
3384 if( !has_destination() && !activity ) {
3385 if( !backlog.empty() ) {
3386 activity = backlog.front();
3387 backlog.pop_front();
3388 current_activity_id = activity.id();
3389 } else {
3390 if( is_player_ally() ) {
3391 add_msg( m_info, string_format( "%s completed the assigned task.", disp_name() ) );
3392 }
3393 current_activity_id = activity_id::NULL_ID();
3394 revert_after_activity();
3395 // if we loaded after being out of the bubble for a while, we might have more
3396 // moves than we need, so clear them
3397 set_moves( 0 );
3398 }
3399 }
3400 return moves != old_moves;
3401}

void npc::drop_items ( units::mass  drop_weight,

)

Definition at line 3142 of file npcmove.cpp.

3143{
3144 /* Remove this when someone debugs it back to functionality */
3145 return;
3146
3147 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is dropping items-%3.2f kg, %3.2f L (%d items, wgt %3.2f/%3.2f kg, "
3148 "vol %3.2f/%3.2f L)",
3149 name, units::to_kilogram( drop_weight ), units::to_liter( drop_volume ), inv.size(),
3150 units::to_kilogram( weight_carried() ), units::to_kilogram( weight_capacity() ),
3151 units::to_liter( volume_carried() ), units::to_liter( volume_capacity() ) );
3152
3153 units::mass weight_dropped = units::from_gram( 0 );
3154 units::volume volume_dropped = units::from_liter( 0 );
3155 std::vector<ratio_index> rWgt, rVol; // Weight/Volume to value ratios
3156
3157 // First fill our ratio vectors, so we know which things to drop first
3158 invslice slice = inv.slice();
3159 for( size_t i = 0; i < slice.size(); i++ ) {
3160 item &it = slice[i]->front();
3161 double wgt_ratio = 0.0;
3162 double vol_ratio = 0.0;
3163 if( value( it ) == 0 || value( it ) <= min_val ) {
3164 wgt_ratio = 99999;
3165 vol_ratio = 99999;
3166 } else {
3167 wgt_ratio = units::to_gram<double>( it.weight() ) / value( it );
3168 vol_ratio = units::to_liter( it.volume() / value( it ) );
3169 }
3170 bool added_wgt = false;
3171 bool added_vol = false;
3172 for( size_t j = 0; j < rWgt.size() && !added_wgt; j++ ) {
3173 if( wgt_ratio > rWgt[j].ratio ) {
3174 added_wgt = true;
3175 rWgt.insert( rWgt.begin() + j, ratio_index( wgt_ratio, i ) );
3176 }
3177 }
3178 if( !added_wgt ) {
3179 rWgt.push_back( ratio_index( wgt_ratio, i ) );
3180 }
3181 for( size_t j = 0; j < rVol.size() && !added_vol; j++ ) {
3182 if( vol_ratio > rVol[j].ratio ) {
3183 added_vol = true;
3184 rVol.insert( rVol.begin() + j, ratio_index( vol_ratio, i ) );
3185 }
3186 }
3187 if( !added_vol ) {
3188 rVol.push_back( ratio_index( vol_ratio, i ) );
3189 }
3190 }
3191
3192 map &here = get_map();
3193 std::string item_name; // For description below
3194 int num_items_dropped = 0; // For description below
3195 // Now, drop items, starting from the top of each list
3196 while( weight_dropped < drop_weight || volume_dropped < drop_volume ) {
3197 // weight and volume may be passed as 0 or a negative value, to indicate that
3198 // decreasing that variable is not important.
3199 int dWeight = units::to_gram<int>( drop_weight ) <= 0 ? -1 :
3200 units::to_gram<int>( drop_weight - weight_dropped ) / 250;
3201 int dVolume = units::to_milliliter<int>( drop_volume ) <= 0 ? -1 :
3202 units::to_milliliter<int>( drop_volume - volume_dropped ) / 250;
3203 int index;
3204 // Which is more important, weight or volume?
3205 if( dWeight > dVolume ) {
3206 index = rWgt[0].index;
3207 rWgt.erase( rWgt.begin() );
3208 // Fix the rest of those indices.
3209 for( auto &elem : rWgt ) {
3210 if( elem.index > index ) {
3211 elem.index--;
3212 }
3213 }
3214 } else {
3215 index = rVol[0].index;
3216 rVol.erase( rVol.begin() );
3217 // Fix the rest of those indices.
3218 for( size_t i = 0; i < rVol.size(); i++ ) {
3219 if( i > rVol.size() ) {
3220 debugmsg( "npc::drop_items() - looping through rVol - Size is %d, i is %d",
3221 rVol.size(), i );
3222 }
3223 if( rVol[i].index > index ) {
3224 rVol[i].index--;
3225 }
3226 }
3227 }
3228 weight_dropped += slice[index]->front().weight();
3229 volume_dropped += slice[index]->front().volume();
3230 item dropped = i_rem( index );
3231 num_items_dropped++;
3232 if( num_items_dropped == 1 ) {
3233 item_name += dropped.tname();
3234 } else if( num_items_dropped == 2 ) {
3235 item_name += _( " and " ) + dropped.tname();
3236 }
3237 if( !is_hallucination() ) { // hallucinations can't drop real items
3238 here.add_item_or_charges( pos(), dropped );
3239 }
3240 }
3241 // Finally, describe the action if u can see it
3242 if( get_player_character().sees( *this ) ) {
3243 if( num_items_dropped >= 3 ) {
3244 add_msg( vgettext( "%s drops %d item.", "%s drops %d items.", num_items_dropped ), name,
3245 num_items_dropped );
3246 } else {
3247 add_msg( _( "%1$s drops a %2$s." ), name, item_name );
3248 }
3249 }
3250 update_worst_item_value();
3251}

◆ enough_time_to_reload()

bool npc::enough_time_to_reload ( const item &  gun) const

Definition at line 2129 of file npcmove.cpp.

2130{
2131 int rltime = item_reload_cost( gun, item( gun.ammo_default() ),
2132 gun.ammo_capacity() );
2133 const float turns_til_reloaded = static_cast<float>( rltime ) / get_speed();
2134
2135 const Creature *target = current_target();
2136 if( target == nullptr ) {
2137 // No target, plenty of time to reload
2138 return true;
2139 }
2140
2141 const auto distance = rl_dist( pos(), target->pos() );
2142 const float target_speed = target->speed_rating();
2143 const float turns_til_reached = distance / target_speed;
2144 if( target->is_player() || target->is_npc() ) {
2145 auto &c = dynamic_cast<const Character &>( *target );
2146 // TODO: Allow reloading if the player has a low accuracy gun
2147 if( sees( c ) && c.weapon.is_gun() && rltime > 200 &&
2148 c.weapon.gun_range( true ) > distance + turns_til_reloaded / target_speed ) {
2149 // Don't take longer than 2 turns if player has a gun
2150 return false;
2151 }
2152 }
2153
2154 // TODO: Handle monsters with ranged attacks and players with CBMs
2155 return turns_til_reloaded < turns_til_reached;
2156}

◆ evaluate_enemy()

float npc::evaluate_enemy ( const Creature &  target) const

rates how dangerous a target is from 0 (harmless) to 1 (max danger)

Definition at line 348 of file npcmove.cpp.

349{
350 if( target.is_monster() ) {
351 const monster &mon = dynamic_cast<const monster &>( target );
352 float diff = static_cast<float>( mon.type->difficulty );
353 return std::min( diff, NPC_DANGER_MAX );
354 } else if( target.is_npc() || target.is_player() ) {
355 return std::min( character_danger( dynamic_cast<const player &>( target ) ),
356 NPC_DANGER_MAX );
357 } else {
358 return 0.0f;
359 }

◆ execute_action()

void npc::execute_action ( npc_action  action)

Definition at line 960 of file npcmove.cpp.

961{
962 int oldmoves = moves;
963 tripoint tar = pos();
964 Creature *cur = current_target();
965 if( action == npc_flee ) {
966 tar = good_escape_direction( false );
967 } else if( cur != nullptr ) {
968 tar = cur->pos();
969 }
970 /*
971 debugmsg("%s ran execute_action() with target = %d! Action %s",
972 name, target, npc_action_name(action));
973 */
974
975 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
976 map &here = get_map();
977 switch( action ) {
978 case npc_pause:
979 move_pause();
980 break;
981 case npc_worker_downtime:
982 worker_downtime();
983 break;
984 case npc_reload: {
985 do_reload( weapon );
986 }
987 break;
988
989 case npc_investigate_sound: {
990 tripoint cur_pos = pos();
991 update_path( here.getlocal( ai_cache.s_abs_pos ) );
992 move_to_next();
993 if( pos() == cur_pos ) {
994 ai_cache.stuck += 1;
995 }
996 }
997 break;
998
999 case npc_return_to_guard_pos: {
1000 const tripoint local_guard_pos = here.getlocal( *ai_cache.guard_pos );
1001 update_path( local_guard_pos );
1002 if( pos() == local_guard_pos || path.empty() ) {
1003 move_pause();
1004 ai_cache.guard_pos = cata::nullopt;
1005 path.clear();
1006 } else {
1007 move_to_next();
1008 }
1009 }
1010 break;
1011
1012 case npc_sleep: {
1013 // TODO: Allow stims when not too tired
1014 // Find a nice spot to sleep
1015 int best_sleepy = sleep_spot( pos() );
1016 tripoint best_spot = pos();
1017 for( const tripoint &p : closest_points_first( pos(), 6 ) ) {
1018 if( !could_move_onto( p ) || !g->is_empty( p ) ) {
1019 continue;
1020 }
1021
1022 // TODO: Blankets when it's cold
1023 const int sleepy = sleep_spot( p );
1024 if( sleepy > best_sleepy ) {
1025 best_sleepy = sleepy;
1026 best_spot = p;
1027 }
1028 }
1029 if( is_walking_with() ) {
1030 complain_about( "napping", 30_minutes, _( "<warn_sleep>" ) );
1031 }
1032 update_path( best_spot );
1033 // TODO: Handle empty path better
1034 if( best_spot == pos() || path.empty() ) {
1035 move_pause();
1036 if( !has_effect( effect_lying_down ) ) {
1037 activate_bionic_by_id( bio_soporific );
1038 add_effect( effect_lying_down, 30_minutes, num_bp, 1 );
1039 if( player_character.sees( *this ) && !player_character.in_sleep_state() ) {
1040 add_msg( _( "%s lies down to sleep." ), name );
1041 }
1042 }
1043 } else {
1044 move_to_next();
1045 }
1046 }
1047 break;
1048
1049 case npc_pickup:
1050 pick_up_item();
1051 break;
1052
1053 case npc_heal:
1054 heal_self();
1055 break;
1056
1057 case npc_use_painkiller:
1058 use_painkiller();
1059 break;
1060
1061 case npc_drop_items:
1062 /* NPCs can't choose this action anymore, but at least it works */
1063 drop_invalid_inventory();
1064 /* drop_items is still broken
1065 * drop_items( weight_carried() - weight_capacity(),
1066 * volume_carried() - volume_capacity() );
1067 */
1068 move_pause();
1069 break;
1070
1071 case npc_flee:
1072 if( path.empty() ) {
1073 move_to( tar );
1074 } else {
1075 move_to_next();
1076 }
1077 break;
1078
1079 case npc_reach_attack:
1080 if( can_use_offensive_cbm() ) {
1081 activate_bionic_by_id( bio_hydraulics );
1082 }
1083 reach_attack( tar );
1084 break;
1085 case npc_melee:
1086 update_path( tar );
1087 if( path.size() > 1 ) {
1088 move_to_next();
1089 } else if( path.size() == 1 ) {
1090 if( cur != nullptr ) {
1091 if( can_use_offensive_cbm() ) {
1092 activate_bionic_by_id( bio_hydraulics );
1093 }
1094 melee_attack( *cur, true );
1095 }
1096 } else {
1097 look_for_player( player_character );
1098 }
1099 break;
1100
1101 case npc_aim:
1102 aim();
1103 break;
1104
1105 case npc_shoot: {
1106 auto mode = weapon.gun_current_mode();
1107 if( !mode ) {
1108 debugmsg( "NPC tried to shoot without valid mode" );
1109 break;
1110 }
1111 aim();
1112 if( is_hallucination() ) {
1113 pretend_fire( this, mode.qty, *mode );
1114 } else {
1115 add_msg( m_debug, "%s recoil on firing: %s", name, recoil );
1116 fire_gun( tar, mode.qty, *mode );
1117 // "discard" the fake bio weapon after shooting it
1118 if( cbm_weapon_index >= 0 ) {
1119 discharge_cbm_weapon();
1120 }
1121 }
1122 break;
1123 }
1124
1125 case npc_look_for_player:
1126 if( saw_player_recently() && last_player_seen_pos && sees( *last_player_seen_pos ) ) {
1127 update_path( *last_player_seen_pos );
1128 move_to_next();
1129 } else {
1130 look_for_player( player_character );
1131 }
1132 break;
1133
1134 case npc_heal_player: {
1135 player *patient = dynamic_cast<player *>( current_ally() );
1136 if( patient ) {
1137 update_path( patient->pos() );
1138 if( path.size() == 1 ) { // We're adjacent to u, and thus can heal u
1139 heal_player( *patient );
1140 } else if( !path.empty() ) {
1141 say( _( "Hold still %s, I'm coming to help you." ), patient->disp_name() );
1142 move_to_next();
1143 } else {
1144 move_pause();
1145 }
1146 }
1147 break;
1148 }
1149 case npc_follow_player:
1150 update_path( player_character.pos() );
1151 if( static_cast<int>( path.size() ) <= follow_distance() &&
1152 player_character.posz() == posz() ) { // We're close enough to u.
1153 move_pause();
1154 } else if( !path.empty() ) {
1155 move_to_next();
1156 } else {
1157 move_pause();
1158 }
1159 // TODO: Make it only happen when it's safe
1160 complain();
1161 break;
1162
1163 case npc_follow_embarked: {
1164 const optional_vpart_position vp = here.veh_at( player_character.pos() );
1165
1166 if( !vp ) {
1167 debugmsg( "Following an embarked player with no vehicle at their location?" );
1168 // TODO: change to wait? - for now pause
1169 move_pause();
1170 break;
1171 }
1172 vehicle *const veh = &vp->vehicle();
1173
1174 // Try to find the last destination
1175 // This is mount point, not actual position
1176 point last_dest( INT_MIN, INT_MIN );
1177 if( !path.empty() && veh_pointer_or_null( here.veh_at( path[path.size() - 1] ) ) == veh ) {
1178 last_dest = vp->mount();
1179 }
1180
1181 // Prioritize last found path, then seats
1182 // Don't change spots if ours is nice
1183 int my_spot = -1;
1184 std::vector<std::pair<int, int> > seats;
1185 for( const vpart_reference &vp : veh->get_avail_parts( VPFLAG_BOARDABLE ) ) {
1186 const player *passenger = veh->get_passenger( vp.part_index() );
1187 if( passenger != this && passenger != nullptr ) {
1188 continue;
1189 }
1190
1191 // a seat is available if either unassigned or assigned to us
1192 auto available_seat = [&]( const vehicle_part & pt ) {
1193 if( !pt.is_seat() ) {
1194 return false;
1195 }
1196 const npc *who = pt.crew();
1197 return !who || who->getID() == getID();
1198 };
1199
1200 const vehicle_part &pt = vp.part();
1201
1202 int priority = 0;
1203
1204 if( vp.mount() == last_dest ) {
1205 // Shares mount point with last known path
1206 // We probably wanted to go there in the last turn
1207 priority = 4;
1208
1209 } else if( available_seat( pt ) ) {
1210 // Assuming player "owns" a sensible vehicle seats should be in good spots to occupy
1211 // Prefer our assigned seat if we have one
1212 const npc *who = pt.crew();
1213 priority = who && who->getID() == getID() ? 3 : 2;
1214
1215 } else if( vp.is_inside() ) {
1216 priority = 1;
1217 }
1218
1219 if( passenger == this ) {
1220 my_spot = priority;
1221 }
1222
1223 seats.push_back( std::make_pair( priority, static_cast<int>( vp.part_index() ) ) );
1224 }
1225
1226 if( my_spot >= 3 ) {
1227 // We won't get any better, so don't try
1228 move_pause();
1229 break;
1230 }
1231
1232 std::sort( seats.begin(), seats.end(),
1233 []( const std::pair<int, int> &l, const std::pair<int, int> &r ) {
1234 return l.first > r.first;
1235 } );
1236
1237 if( seats.empty() ) {
1238 // TODO: be angry at player, switch to wait or leave - for now pause
1239 move_pause();
1240 break;
1241 }
1242
1243 // Only check few best seats - pathfinding can get expensive
1244 const size_t try_max = std::min<size_t>( 4, seats.size() );
1245 for( size_t i = 0; i < try_max; i++ ) {
1246 if( seats[i].first <= my_spot ) {
1247 // We have a nicer spot than this
1248 // Note: this will make NPCs steal player's seat...
1249 break;
1250 }
1251
1252 const int cur_part = seats[i].second;
1253
1254 tripoint pp = veh->global_part_pos3( cur_part );
1255 update_path( pp, true );
1256 if( !path.empty() ) {
1257 // All is fine
1258 move_to_next();
1259 break;
1260 }
1261 }
1262
1263 // TODO: Check the rest
1264 move_pause();
1265 }
1266
1267 break;
1268 case npc_talk_to_player:
1269 talk_to_u();
1270 moves = 0;
1271 break;
1272
1273 case npc_mug_player:
1274 mug_player( player_character );
1275 break;
1276
1277 case npc_goto_destination:
1278 go_to_omt_destination();
1279 break;
1280
1281 case npc_avoid_friendly_fire:
1282 avoid_friendly_fire();
1283 break;
1284
1285 case npc_escape_explosion:
1286 escape_explosion();
1287 break;
1288
1289 case npc_player_activity:
1290 do_player_activity();
1291 break;
1292
1293 case npc_undecided:
1294 complain();
1295 move_pause();
1296 break;
1297
1298 case npc_noop:
1299 add_msg( m_debug, "%s skips turn (noop)", disp_name() );
1300 return;
1301
1302 default:
1303 debugmsg( "Unknown NPC action (%d)", action );
1304 }
1305
1306 if( oldmoves == moves ) {
1307 add_msg( m_debug, "NPC didn't use its moves. Action %s (%d).",
1308 npc_action_name( action ), action );
1309 }

531 }
532 }
533 const bool is_stationed = assigned_camp && temp_camp;
534 std::string direction = direction_name( direction_from( player_abspos, guy_abspos ) );
535 if( direction != "center" ) {
536 mvwprintz( fac_w, point( width, ++y ), col, _( "Direction: to the " ) + direction );
537 } else {
538 mvwprintz( fac_w, point( width, ++y ), col, _( "Direction: Nearby" ) );
539 }
540 if( is_stationed ) {
541 mvwprintz( fac_w, point( width, ++y ), col, _( "Location: %s, at camp: %s" ),
542 guy_abspos.to_string(), temp_camp->camp_name() );
543 } else {
544 mvwprintz( fac_w, point( width, ++y ), col, _( "Location: %s" ), guy_abspos.to_string() );
545 }
546 std::string can_see;
547 nc_color see_color;
548 bool u_has_radio = g->u.has_item_with_flag( "TWO_WAY_RADIO", true );
549 bool guy_has_radio = has_item_with_flag( "TWO_WAY_RADIO", true );
550 // is the NPC even in the same area as the player?
551 if( rl_dist( player_abspos, global_omt_location() ) > 3 ||
552 ( rl_dist( g->u.pos(), pos() ) > SEEX * 2 || !g->u.sees( pos() ) ) ) {
553 if( u_has_radio && guy_has_radio ) {
554 // TODO: better range calculation than just elevation.
555 int max_range = 200;
556 max_range *= ( 1 + ( g->u.pos().z * 0.1 ) );
557 max_range *= ( 1 + ( pos().z * 0.1 ) );
558 if( is_stationed ) {
559 // if camp that NPC is at, has a radio tower
560 if( temp_camp->has_provides( "radio_tower" ) ) {
561 max_range *= 5;
562 }
563 }
564 // if camp that player is at, has a radio tower
565 cata::optional<basecamp *> player_camp =
566 overmap_buffer.find_camp( g->u.global_omt_location().xy() );
567 if( const cata::optional<basecamp *> player_camp = overmap_buffer.find_camp(
568 g->u.global_omt_location().xy() ) ) {
569 if( ( *player_camp )->has_provides( "radio_tower" ) ) {
570 max_range *= 5;
571 }
572 }
573 if( ( ( g->u.pos().z >= 0 && pos().z >= 0 ) || ( g->u.pos().z == pos().z ) ) &&
574 square_dist( g->u.global_sm_location(), global_sm_location() ) <= max_range ) {
575 retval = 2;
576 can_see = _( "Within radio range" );
577 see_color = c_light_green;
578 } else {
579 can_see = _( "Not within radio range" );
580 see_color = c_light_red;
581 }
582 } else if( guy_has_radio && !u_has_radio ) {
583 can_see = _( "You do not have a radio" );
584 see_color = c_light_red;
585 } else if( !guy_has_radio && u_has_radio ) {
586 can_see = _( "Follower does not have a radio" );
587 see_color = c_light_red;
588 } else {
589 can_see = _( "Both you and follower need a radio" );
590 see_color = c_light_red;
591 }
592 } else {
593 retval = 1;
594 can_see = _( "Within interaction range" );
595 see_color = c_light_green;
596 }
597 // TODO: NPCS on mission contactable same as traveling
598 if( has_companion_mission() ) {
599 can_see = _( "Press enter to recall from their mission." );
600 see_color = c_light_red;
601 }
602 mvwprintz( fac_w, point( width, ++y ), see_color, "%s", can_see );
603 nc_color status_col = col;
604 std::string current_status = _( "Status: " );
605 if( current_target() != nullptr ) {
606 current_status += _( "In Combat!" );
607 status_col = c_light_red;
608 } else if( in_sleep_state() ) {
609 current_status += _( "Sleeping" );
610 } else if( is_following() ) {
611 current_status += _( "Following" );
612 } else if( is_leader() ) {
613 current_status += _( "Leading" );
614 } else if( is_patrolling() ) {
615 current_status += _( "Patrolling" );
616 } else if( is_guarding() ) {
617 current_status += _( "Guarding" );
618 }
619 mvwprintz( fac_w, point( width, ++y ), status_col, current_status );
620 if( is_stationed && has_job() ) {
621 mvwprintz( fac_w, point( width, ++y ), col, _( "Working at camp" ) );
622 } else if( is_stationed ) {
623 mvwprintz( fac_w, point( width, ++y ), col, _( "Idling at camp" ) );
624 }
625
626 const std::pair <std::string, nc_color> condition = hp_description();
627 mvwprintz( fac_w, point( width, ++y ), condition.second, _( "Condition: " ) + condition.first );
628 const std::pair <std::string, nc_color> hunger_pair = get_hunger_description();
629 const std::pair <std::string, nc_color> thirst_pair = get_thirst_description();
630 const std::pair <std::string, nc_color> fatigue_pair = get_fatigue_description();
631 const std::string nominal = pgettext( "needs", "Nominal" );
632 mvwprintz( fac_w, point( width, ++y ), hunger_pair.second,
633 _( "Hunger: " ) + ( hunger_pair.first.empty() ? nominal : hunger_pair.first ) );
634 mvwprintz( fac_w, point( width, ++y ), thirst_pair.second,
635 _( "Thirst: " ) + ( thirst_pair.first.empty() ? nominal : thirst_pair.first ) );
636 mvwprintz( fac_w, point( width, ++y ), fatigue_pair.second,
637 _( "Fatigue: " ) + ( fatigue_pair.first.empty() ? nominal : fatigue_pair.first ) );
638 int lines = fold_and_print( fac_w, point( width, ++y ), getmaxx( fac_w ) - width - 2, c_white,
639 _( "Wielding: " ) + weapon.tname() );
640 y += lines;
641
642 const auto skillslist = Skill::get_skills_sorted_by( [&]( const Skill & a, const Skill & b ) {
643 const int level_a = get_skill_level( a.ident() );
644 const int level_b = get_skill_level( b.ident() );
645 return localized_compare( std::make_pair( -level_a, a.name() ),
646 std::make_pair( -level_b, b.name() ) );
647 } );
648 size_t count = 0;
649 std::vector<std::string> skill_strs;
650 for( size_t i = 0; i < skillslist.size() && count < 3; i++ ) {
651 if( !skillslist[ i ]->is_combat_skill() ) {
652 std::string skill_str = string_format( "%s: %d", skillslist[i]->name(),
653 get_skill_level( skillslist[i]->ident() ) );
654 skill_strs.push_back( skill_str );
655 count += 1;
656 }
657 }
658 std::string best_three_noncombat = _( "Best other skills: " );
659 std::string best_skill_text = string_format( _( "Best combat skill: %s: %d" ),
660 best_skill().obj().name(), best_skill_level() );
661 mvwprintz( fac_w, point( width, ++y ), col, best_skill_text );
662 mvwprintz( fac_w, point( width, ++y ), col, best_three_noncombat + skill_strs[0] );
663 mvwprintz( fac_w, point( width + 20, ++y ), col, skill_strs[1] );
664 mvwprintz( fac_w, point( width + 20, ++y ), col, skill_strs[2] );
665 return retval;
666}

3260 }
3261
3262 map &here = get_map();
3263 // Pathing with overdraw can get expensive, limit it
3264 int path_counter = 4;
3265 const auto check_tile = [this, &path_counter, &here]( const tripoint & p ) -> const item * {
3266 if( !here.sees_some_items( p, *this ) || !sees( p ) )
3267 {
3268 return nullptr;
3269 }
3270
3271 const map_stack items = here.i_at( p );
3272 const item *found = nullptr;
3273 for( const item &it : items )
3274 {
3275 // Pulp only stuff that revives, but don't pulp acid stuff
3276 // That is, if you aren't protected from this stuff!
3277 if( it.can_revive() ) {
3278 // If the first encountered corpse bleeds something dangerous then
3279 // it is not safe to bash.
3280 if( is_dangerous_field( field_entry( it.get_mtype()->bloodType(), 1, 0_turns ) ) ) {
3281 return nullptr;
3282 }
3283
3284 found = &it;
3285 break;
3286 }
3287 }
3288
3289 if( found != nullptr )
3290 {
3291 path_counter--;
3292 // Only return corpses we can path to
3293 return update_path( p, false, false ) ? found : nullptr;
3294 }
3295
3296 return nullptr;
3297 };
3298
3299 const int range = 6;
3300
3301 const item *corpse = nullptr;
3302 if( pulp_location && square_dist( pos(), *pulp_location ) <= range ) {
3303 corpse = check_tile( *pulp_location );
3304 }
3305
3306 // Find the old target to avoid spamming
3307 const item *old_target = corpse;
3308
3309 if( corpse == nullptr ) {
3310 // If we're following the player, don't wander off to pulp corpses
3311 const tripoint &around = is_walking_with() ? player_character.pos() : pos();

3313 special_item_type::corpse ) ) {
3314 corpse = check_tile( location.position() );
3315
3316 if( corpse != nullptr ) {
3317 pulp_location.emplace( location.position() );
3318 break;
3319 }
3320
3321 if( path_counter <= 0 ) {
3322 break;
3323 }
3324 }
3325 }
3326
3327 if( corpse != nullptr && corpse != old_target && is_walking_with() ) {
3328 say( _( "Hold on, I want to pulp that %s." ), corpse->tname() );
3329 }
3330
3331 return corpse != nullptr;
3332}

std::vector< sphere > npc::find_dangerous_explosives ( ) const
private

316{
317 std::vector<sphere> result;
318
319 const auto active_items = get_map().get_active_items_in_radius( pos(), MAX_VIEW_DISTANCE,
320 special_item_type::explosive );
321
322 for( const auto &elem : active_items ) {
323 const auto use = elem->type->get_use( "explosion" );
324
325 if( !use ) {
326 continue;
327 }
328
329 const explosion_iuse *actor = dynamic_cast<const explosion_iuse *>( use->get_actor_ptr() );
330 const int safe_range = actor->explosion.safe_range();
331
332 if( rl_dist( pos(), elem.position() ) >= safe_range ) {
333 continue; // Far enough.
334 }
335
336 const int turns_to_evacuate = 2 * safe_range / speed_rating();
337
338 if( elem->charges > turns_to_evacuate ) {
339 continue; // Consider only imminent dangers.
340 }
341
342 result.emplace_back( elem.position(), safe_range );
343 }
344
345 return result;
346}

◆ find_item()

void npc::find_item ( )

2790{
2791 if( is_hallucination() ) {

2793 see_item_say_smth( itype_lsd, "<yes_to_lsd>" );
2794 return;
2795 }
2796
2797 if( is_player_ally() && !rules.has_flag( ally_rule::allow_pick_up ) ) {
2798 // Grabbing stuff not allowed by our "owner"
2799 return;
2800 }
2801
2802 fetching_item = false;
2803 int best_value = minimum_item_value();
2804 // Not perfect, but has to mirror pickup code
2805 units::volume volume_allowed = volume_capacity() - volume_carried();
2806 units::mass weight_allowed = weight_capacity() - weight_carried();
2807 // For some reason range limiting by vision doesn't work properly
2808 const int range = 6;
2809 //int range = sight_range( g->light_level( posz() ) );
2810 //range = std::max( 1, std::min( 12, range ) );

2813
2814 const item *wanted = nullptr;
2815
2816 const bool whitelisting = has_item_whitelist();
2817
2818 if( volume_allowed <= 0_ml || weight_allowed <= 0_gram ) {
2819 return;
2820 }
2821
2822 const auto consider_item =
2823 [&wanted, &best_value, whitelisting, volume_allowed, weight_allowed, this]
2824 ( const item & it, const tripoint & p ) {
2825 if( it.made_of( LIQUID ) ) {
2826 // Don't even consider liquids.
2827 return;
2828 }
2829 std::vector<npc *> followers;
2830 for( auto &elem : g->get_follower_list() ) {
2831 shared_ptr_fast<npc> npc_to_get = overmap_buffer.find_npc( elem );
2832 if( !npc_to_get ) {
2833 continue;
2834 }
2835 npc *npc_to_add = npc_to_get.get();
2836 followers.push_back( npc_to_add );
2837 }
2838 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
2839 for( auto &elem : followers ) {
2840 if( !it.is_owned_by( *this, true ) && ( player_character.sees( this->pos() ) ||
2841 player_character.sees( wanted_item_pos ) ||
2842 elem->sees( this->pos() ) || elem->sees( wanted_item_pos ) ) ) {
2843 return;
2844 }
2845 }
2846 if( whitelisting && !item_whitelisted( it ) ) {
2847 return;
2848 }
2849
2850 // When using a whitelist, skip the value check
2851 // TODO: Whitelist hierarchy?
2852 int itval = whitelisting ? 1000 : value( it );
2853
2854 if( itval > best_value &&
2855 ( it.volume() <= volume_allowed && it.weight() <= weight_allowed ) ) {
2856 wanted_item_pos = p;
2857 wanted = &( it );
2858 best_value = itval;
2859 }
2860 };
2861
2862 map &here = get_map();
2863 // Harvest item doesn't exist, so we'll be checking by its name
2864 std::string wanted_name;
2865 const auto consider_terrain =
2866 [ this, whitelisting, volume_allowed, &wanted, &wanted_name, &here ]( const tripoint & p ) {
2867 // We only want to pick plants when there are no items to pick
2868 if( !whitelisting || wanted != nullptr || !wanted_name.empty() || volume_allowed < 250_ml ) {
2869 return;
2870 }
2871
2872 const auto &harvest = here.get_harvest_names( p );
2873 for( const auto &entry : harvest ) {
2874 if( item_name_whitelisted( entry ) ) {
2875 wanted_name = entry;
2876 wanted_item_pos = p;
2877 break;
2878 }
2879 }
2880 };
2881
2882 for( const tripoint &p : closest_points_first( pos(), range ) ) {
2883 // TODO: Make this sight check not overdraw nearby tiles
2884 // TODO: Optimize that zone check
2885 if( is_player_ally() && g->check_zone( zone_type_no_npc_pickup, p ) ) {
2886 continue;
2887 }
2888
2889 const tripoint abs_p = global_square_location() - pos() + p;
2890 const int prev_num_items = ai_cache.searched_tiles.get( abs_p, -1 );
2891 // Prefetch the number of items present so we can bail out if we already checked here.
2892 const map_stack m_stack = here.i_at( p );
2893 int num_items = m_stack.size();
2894 const optional_vpart_position vp = here.veh_at( p );
2895 if( vp ) {
2896 const cata::optional<vpart_reference> cargo = vp.part_with_feature( VPFLAG_CARGO, true );
2897 if( cargo ) {
2898 vehicle_stack v_stack = cargo->vehicle().get_items( cargo->part_index() );
2899 num_items += v_stack.size();
2900 }
2901 }
2902 if( prev_num_items == num_items ) {
2903 continue;
2904 }
2905 auto cache_tile = [this, &abs_p, num_items, &wanted]() {
2906 if( wanted == nullptr ) {
2907 ai_cache.searched_tiles.insert( 1000, abs_p, num_items );
2908 }
2909 };
2910 bool can_see = false;
2911 if( here.sees_some_items( p, *this ) && sees( p ) ) {
2912 can_see = true;
2913 for( const item &it : m_stack ) {
2914 consider_item( it, p );
2915 }
2916 }
2917
2918 // Not cached because it gets checked once and isn't expected to change.
2919 if( can_see || sees( p ) ) {
2920 can_see = true;
2921 consider_terrain( p );
2922 }
2923
2924 if( !vp || vp->vehicle().is_moving() || !( can_see || sees( p ) ) ) {
2925 cache_tile();
2926 continue;
2927 }
2928 const cata::optional<vpart_reference> cargo = vp.part_with_feature( VPFLAG_CARGO, true );
2929 static const std::string locked_string( "LOCKED" );
2930 // TODO: Let player know what parts are safe from NPC thieves
2931 if( !cargo || cargo->has_feature( locked_string ) ) {
2932 cache_tile();
2933 continue;
2934 }
2935
2936 static const std::string cargo_locking_string( "CARGO_LOCKING" );
2937 if( vp.part_with_feature( cargo_locking_string, true ) ) {
2938 cache_tile();
2939 continue;
2940 }
2941
2942 for( const item &it : cargo->vehicle().get_items( cargo->part_index() ) ) {
2943 consider_item( it, p );
2944 }
2945 cache_tile();
2946 }
2947
2948 if( wanted != nullptr ) {
2949 wanted_name = wanted->tname();
2950 }
2951
2952 if( wanted_name.empty() ) {
2953 return;
2954 }
2955
2956 fetching_item = true;
2957
2958 // TODO: Move that check above, make it multi-target pathing and use it
2959 // to limit tiles available for choice of items
2960 const int dist_to_item = rl_dist( wanted_item_pos, pos() );
2961 if( const cata::optional<tripoint> dest = nearest_passable( wanted_item_pos, pos() ) ) {
2962 update_path( *dest );
2963 }
2964
2965 if( path.empty() && dist_to_item > 1 ) {
2966 // Item not reachable, let's just totally give up for now
2967 fetching_item = false;
2968 }
2969
2970 if( fetching_item && rl_dist( wanted_item_pos, pos() ) > 1 && is_walking_with() ) {
2971 say( _( "Hold on, I want to pick up that %s." ), wanted_name );
2972 }
2973}

1501 return VisitResponse::NEXT;
1502 }
1503 const auto it_loc = select_ammo( *node ).ammo;
1504 if( it_loc && wants_to_reload_with( *node, *it_loc ) ) {
1505 reloadable = node;
1506 return VisitResponse::ABORT;
1507 }

1510 } );
1511

1513 return *reloadable;
1514 }

◆ finish_read()

void npc::finish_read ( item_location  loc)
Intelligence increases reading comprehension

Definition at line 898 of file npc.cpp.

899{
900 if( !loc ) {
901 revert_after_activity();
902 return;
903 }
904
905 item &book = *loc;
906 const auto &reading = book.type->book;
907 if( !reading ) {
908 revert_after_activity();
909 return;
910 }
911 const skill_id &skill = reading->skill;
912 // NPCs don't need to identify the book or learn recipes yet.
913 // NPCs don't read to other NPCs yet.
914 const bool display_messages = my_fac->id == faction_id( "your_followers" ) && g->u.sees( pos() );
915 bool continuous = false; //whether to continue reading or not
916
917 int book_fun_for = character_funcs::get_book_fun_for( *this, book );
918 if( book_fun_for != 0 ) {
919 add_morale( MORALE_BOOK, book_fun_for * 5, book_fun_for * 15, 1_hours, 30_minutes, true,
920 book.type );
921 }
922
923 book.mark_chapter_as_read( *this );
924
925 if( skill && get_skill_level( skill ) < reading->level &&
926 get_skill_level_object( skill ).can_train() ) {
927 SkillLevel &skill_level = get_skill_level_object( skill );
928 const int originalSkillLevel = skill_level.level();
929
930 // Calculate experience gained
931 /** @EFFECT_INT increases reading comprehension */
932 // Enhanced Memory Banks modestly boosts experience
933 int min_ex = std::max( 1, reading->time / 10 + get_int() / 4 );
934 int max_ex = reading->time / 5 + get_int() / 2 - originalSkillLevel;
935 if( has_active_bionic( bio_memory ) ) {
936 min_ex += 2;
937 }
938 if( max_ex < 2 ) {
939 max_ex = 2;
940 }
941 if( max_ex > 10 ) {
942 max_ex = 10;
943 }
944 if( max_ex < min_ex ) {
945 max_ex = min_ex;
946 }
947 const std::string &s = activity.get_str_value( 0, "1" );
948 double penalty = strtod( s.c_str(), nullptr );
949 min_ex *= ( originalSkillLevel + 1 ) * penalty;
950 min_ex = std::max( min_ex, 1 );
951 max_ex *= ( originalSkillLevel + 1 ) * penalty;
952 max_ex = std::max( min_ex, max_ex );
953
954 skill_level.readBook( min_ex, max_ex, reading->level );
955
956 std::string skill_name = skill.obj().name();
957
958 if( skill_level != originalSkillLevel ) {
959 g->events().send<event_type::gains_skill_level>( getID(), skill, skill_level.level() );
960 if( display_messages ) {
961 add_msg( m_good, _( "%s increases their %s level." ), disp_name(), skill_name );
962 // NPC reads until they gain a level, then stop.
963 revert_after_activity();
964 return;
965 }
966 } else {
967 continuous = true;
968 if( display_messages ) {
969 add_msg( m_info, _( "%s learns a little about %s!" ), disp_name(), skill.obj().name() );
970 }
971 }
972
973 if( ( skill_level == reading->level || !skill_level.can_train() ) ||
974 ( ( has_trait( trait_SCHIZOPHRENIC ) ||
975 has_artifact_with( AEP_SCHIZO ) ) && one_in( 25 ) ) ) {
976 if( display_messages ) {
977 add_msg( m_info, _( "%s can no longer learn from %s." ), disp_name(), book.type_name() );
978 }
979 }
980 } else if( skill ) {
981 if( display_messages ) {
982 add_msg( m_info, _( "%s can no longer learn from %s." ), disp_name(), book.type_name() );
983 }
984 }
985
986 // NPCs can't learn martial arts from manuals (yet)
987
988 if( continuous ) {
989 activity.set_to_null();
990 player *pl = dynamic_cast<player *>( this );
991 if( pl ) {
992 start_read( loc, pl );
993 }
994 if( activity ) {
995 return;
996 }
997 }
998 activity.set_to_null();
999 revert_after_activity();
1000}

◆ follow_distance()

int npc::follow_distance ( ) const

Definition at line 2200 of file npc.cpp.

2201{
2202 // HACK: If the player is standing on stairs, follow closely
2203 // This makes the stair hack less painful to use
2204 if( is_walking_with() &&
2205 ( g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_GOES_DOWN, g->u.pos() ) ||
2206 g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_GOES_UP, g->u.pos() ) ) ) {
2207 return 1;
2208 }
2209 // Uses ally_rule follow_distance_2 to determine if should follow by 2 or 4 tiles
2210 if( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::follow_distance_2 ) ) {
2211 return 2;
2212 }
2213 // If NPC doesn't see player, change follow distance to 2
2214 if( !sees( g->u ) ) {
2215 return 2;
2216 }
2217 return 4;
2218}

◆ form_opinion()

void npc::form_opinion ( const player &  u)
Strength increases NPC fear of the player

Definition at line 1213 of file npc.cpp.

1214{
1215 // FEAR
1216 if( u.weapon.is_gun() ) {
1217 // TODO: Make bows not guns
1218 if( weapon.is_gun() ) {
1219 op_of_u.fear += 2;
1220 } else {
1221 op_of_u.fear += 6;
1222 }
1223 } else if( u.weapon_value( u.weapon ) > 20 ) {
1224 op_of_u.fear += 2;
1225 } else if( !u.is_armed() ) {
1226 // Unarmed, but actually unarmed ("unarmed weapons" are not unarmed)
1227 op_of_u.fear -= 3;
1228 }
1229
1230 ///\EFFECT_STR increases NPC fear of the player
1231 if( u.str_max >= 16 ) {
1232 op_of_u.fear += 2;
1233 } else if( u.str_max >= 12 ) {
1234 op_of_u.fear += 1;
1235 } else if( u.str_max <= 3 ) {
1236 op_of_u.fear -= 3;
1237 } else if( u.str_max <= 5 ) {
1238 op_of_u.fear -= 1;
1239 }
1240
1241 // is your health low
1242 for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, bodypart> &elem : get_player_character().get_body() ) {
1243 const int hp_max = elem.second.get_hp_max();
1244 const int hp_cur = elem.second.get_hp_cur();
1245 if( hp_cur <= hp_max / 2 ) {
1246 op_of_u.fear--;
1247 }
1248 }
1249
1250 // is my health low
1251 for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, bodypart> &elem : get_body() ) {
1252 const int hp_max = elem.second.get_hp_max();
1253 const int hp_cur = elem.second.get_hp_cur();
1254 if( hp_cur <= hp_max / 2 ) {
1255 op_of_u.fear++;
1256 }
1257 }
1258
1259 if( u.has_trait( trait_SAPIOVORE ) ) {
1260 op_of_u.fear += 10; // Sapiovores = Scary
1261 }
1262 if( u.has_trait( trait_TERRIFYING ) ) {
1263 op_of_u.fear += 6;
1264 }
1265
1266 int u_ugly = 0;
1267 for( trait_id &mut : u.get_mutations() ) {
1268 u_ugly += mut.obj().ugliness;
1269 }
1270 op_of_u.fear += u_ugly / 2;
1271 op_of_u.trust -= u_ugly / 3;
1272
1273 if( u.get_stim() > 20 ) {
1274 op_of_u.fear++;
1275 }
1276
1277 if( u.has_effect( effect_drunk ) ) {
1278 op_of_u.fear -= 2;
1279 }
1280
1281 // TRUST
1282 if( op_of_u.fear > 0 ) {
1283 op_of_u.trust -= 3;
1284 } else {
1285 op_of_u.trust += 1;
1286 }
1287
1288 if( u.weapon.is_gun() ) {
1289 op_of_u.trust -= 2;
1290 } else if( !u.is_armed() ) {
1291 op_of_u.trust += 2;
1292 }
1293
1294 // TODO: More effects
1295 if( u.has_effect( effect_drunk ) ) {
1296 op_of_u.trust -= 2;
1297 }
1298 if( u.get_stim() > 20 || u.get_stim() < -20 ) {
1299 op_of_u.trust -= 1;
1300 }
1301 if( u.get_painkiller() > 30 ) {
1302 op_of_u.trust -= 1;
1303 }
1304
1305 if( op_of_u.trust > 0 ) {
1306 // Trust is worth a lot right now
1307 op_of_u.trust /= 2;
1308 }
1309
1310 // VALUE
1311 op_of_u.value = 0;
1312 for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, bodypart> &elem : get_body() ) {
1313 if( elem.second.get_hp_cur() < elem.second.get_hp_max() * 0.8f ) {
1314 op_of_u.value++;
1315 }
1316 }
1317 decide_needs();
1318 for( const npc_need &i : needs ) {
1319 if( i == need_food || i == need_drink ) {
1320 op_of_u.value += 2;
1321 }
1322 }
1323
1324 if( op_of_u.fear < personality.bravery + 10 &&
1325 op_of_u.fear - personality.aggression > -10 && op_of_u.trust > -8 ) {
1326 set_attitude( NPCATT_TALK );
1327 } else if( op_of_u.fear - 2 * personality.aggression - personality.bravery < -30 ) {
1328 set_attitude( NPCATT_KILL );
1329 } else if( my_fac && my_fac->likes_u < -10 ) {
1330 if( is_player_ally() ) {
1331 mutiny();
1332 }
1333 set_attitude( NPCATT_KILL );
1334 } else {
1335 set_attitude( NPCATT_FLEE_TEMP );
1336 }
1337
1338 add_msg( m_debug, "%s formed an opinion of u: %s", name, npc_attitude_id( attitude ) );
1339}

◆ get_pathfinding_settings() [2/2]

const pathfinding_settings & npc::get_pathfinding_settings ( bool  no_bashing) const

Definition at line 2913 of file npc.cpp.

2914{
2915 path_settings->bash_strength = no_bashing ? 0 : smash_ability();
2916 // TODO: Extract climb skill
2917 const int climb = std::min( 20, get_dex() );
2918 if( climb > 1 ) {
2919 // Success is !one_in(dex), so 0%, 50%, 66%, 75%...
2920 // Penalty for failure chance is 1/success = 1/(1-failure) = 1/(1-(1/dex)) = dex/(dex-1)
2921 path_settings->climb_cost = ( 10 - climb / 5 ) * climb / ( climb - 1 );
2922 } else {
2923 // Climbing at this dexterity will always fail
2924 path_settings->climb_cost = 0;
2925 }
2926
2927 return *path_settings;
2928}

◆ global_square_location()

tripoint npc::global_square_location ( ) const
overridevirtual

Global position, expressed in map square coordinate system (the most detailed coordinate system), used by the map.

The (global) position of an NPC is always: point( submap_coords.x * SEEX + posx() % SEEX, submap_coords.y * SEEY + posy() % SEEY, pos.z) (Expressed in map squares, the system that map uses.) Any of om, map, pos can be in any range. For active NPCs pos would be in the valid range required by the map. But pos, map, and om can be changed without the NPC actual moving as long as the position stays the same: pos() += SEEX; submap_coords.x -= 1; This does not change the global position of the NPC.

Reimplemented from Character.

Definition at line 739 of file npc.cpp.

740{
741 return sm_to_ms_copy( submap_coords ) + tripoint( posx() % SEEX, posy() % SEEY, position.z );
742}
Character::posx
int posx() const override
Definition: character.h:779
Character::posy
int posy() const override
Definition: character.h:782
sm_to_ms_copy
point sm_to_ms_copy(const point &p)
Definition: coordinate_conversions.cpp:146
SEEY
static constexpr int SEEY
Definition: game_constants.h:37

References Character::position, Character::posx(), Character::posy(), SEEX, SEEY, sm_to_ms_copy(), submap_coords, and tripoint::z.

Referenced by talk_function::basecamp_mission(), find_item(), good_escape_direction(), and map::rotate().

◆ go_to_omt_destination()

void npc::go_to_omt_destination ( )
