4204{
4205 map &here = get_map();
4206 if( ai_cache.guard_pos ) {
4207 if( here.getabs( pos() ) == *ai_cache.guard_pos ) {
4208 path.clear();
4209 ai_cache.guard_pos = cata::nullopt;
4210 move_pause();
4211 return;
4212 }
4213 }
4214 if( goal == no_goal_point || omt_path.empty() ) {
4215 add_msg( m_debug, "npc::go_to_destination with no goal" );
4216 move_pause();
4217 reach_omt_destination();
4218 return;
4219 }
4220 const tripoint_abs_omt omt_pos = global_omt_location();
4221 if( goal == omt_pos ) {
4222 // We're at our desired map square! Pause to keep the NPC infinite loop counter happy
4223 move_pause();
4224 reach_omt_destination();
4225 return;
4226 }
4227 if( !path.empty() ) {
4228 // we already have a path, just use that until we can't.
4229 move_to_next();
4230 return;
4231 }
4232 // get the next path point
4233 if( omt_path.back() == omt_pos ) {
4234 // this should be the square we are at.
4235 omt_path.pop_back();
4236 }
4237 if( !omt_path.empty() ) {
4238 point_rel_omt omt_diff = omt_path.back().xy() - omt_pos.xy();
4239 if( omt_diff.x() > 3 || omt_diff.x() < -3 || omt_diff.y() > 3 || omt_diff.y() < -3 ) {
4240 // we've gone wandering somehow, reset destination.
4241 if( !is_player_ally() ) {
4242 set_omt_destination();
4243 } else {
4244 talk_function::assign_guard( *this );
4245 }
4246 return;
4247 }
4248 }
4249 // TODO: fix point types
4250 tripoint sm_tri =
4251 here.getlocal( project_to<coords::ms>( omt_path.back() ).raw() );
4252 tripoint centre_sub = sm_tri + point( SEEX, SEEY );
4253 if( !here.passable( centre_sub ) ) {
4254 auto candidates = here.points_in_radius( centre_sub, 2 );
4255 for( const auto &elem : candidates ) {
4256 if( here.passable( elem ) ) {
4257 centre_sub = elem;
4258 break;
4259 }
4260 }
4261 }
4262 path = here.route( pos(), centre_sub, get_pathfinding_settings(), get_path_avoid() );
4263 add_msg( m_debug, "%s going %s->%s", name, omt_pos.to_string(), goal.to_string() );
4264
4265 if( !path.empty() ) {
4266 move_to_next();
4267 return;
4268 }
4269 move_pause();
4270}

◆ good_escape_direction()

tripoint npc::good_escape_direction ( bool  include_pos = true)

Definition at line 232 of file npcmove.cpp.

233{
234 map &here = get_map();
235 if( path.empty() ) {
236 zone_type_id retreat_zone = zone_type_id( "NPC_RETREAT" );
237 const tripoint &abs_pos = global_square_location();
238 const zone_manager &mgr = zone_manager::get_manager();
239 cata::optional<tripoint> retreat_target = mgr.get_nearest( retreat_zone, abs_pos, 60,
240 fac_id );
241 if( retreat_target && *retreat_target != abs_pos ) {
242 update_path( here.getlocal( *retreat_target ) );
243 if( !path.empty() ) {
244 return path[0];
245 }
246 }
247 }
248
249 std::vector<tripoint> candidates;
250
251 const auto rate_pt = [&]( const tripoint & pt, const float threat_val ) {
252 if( !can_move_to( pt, !rules.has_flag( ally_rule::allow_bash ) ) ) {
253 return MAX_FLOAT;
254 }
255 float rating = threat_val;
256 for( const auto &e : here.field_at( pt ) ) {
257 if( is_dangerous_field( e.second ) ) {
258 // TODO: Rate fire higher than smoke
259 rating += e.second.get_field_intensity();
260 }
261 }
262 return rating;
263 };
264
265 float best_rating = include_pos ? rate_pt( pos(), 0.0f ) : FLT_MAX;
266 candidates.emplace_back( pos() );
267
268 std::map<direction, float> adj_map;
269 for( direction pt_dir : npc_threat_dir ) {
270 const tripoint &pt = pos() + direction_XY( pt_dir );
271 float cur_rating = rate_pt( pt, ai_cache.threat_map[ pt_dir ] );
272 adj_map[pt_dir] = cur_rating;
273 if( cur_rating == best_rating ) {
274 candidates.emplace_back( pos() + direction_XY( pt_dir ) );
275 } else if( cur_rating < best_rating ) {
276 candidates.clear();
277 candidates.emplace_back( pos() + direction_XY( pt_dir ) );
278 best_rating = cur_rating;
279 }
280 }
281 return random_entry( candidates );
282}

◆ handle_sound()

void npc::handle_sound ( sounds::sound_t  priority,
const std::string &  description,
int  heard_volume,
const tripoint &  spos 
)

Definition at line 626 of file npctalk.cpp.

628{
629 const tripoint s_abs_pos = g->m.getabs( spos );
630 const tripoint my_abs_pos = g->m.getabs( pos() );
631
632 add_msg( m_debug, "%s heard '%s', priority %d at volume %d from %d:%d, my pos %d:%d",
633 disp_name(), description, static_cast<int>( spriority ), heard_volume,
634 s_abs_pos.x, s_abs_pos.y, my_abs_pos.x, my_abs_pos.y );
635
636 bool player_ally = g->u.pos() == spos && is_player_ally();
637 player *const sound_source = g->critter_at<player>( spos );
638 bool npc_ally = sound_source && sound_source->is_npc() && is_ally( *sound_source );
639
640 if( ( player_ally || npc_ally ) && spriority == sounds::sound_t::order ) {
641 say( "<acknowledged>" );
642 }
643
644 if( sees( spos ) || is_hallucination() ) {
645 return;
646 }
647 // ignore low priority sounds if the NPC "knows" it came from a friend.
648 // TODO: NPC will need to respond to talking noise eventually
649 // but only for bantering purposes, not for investigating.
650 if( spriority < sounds::sound_t::alarm ) {
651 if( player_ally ) {
652 add_msg( m_debug, "Allied NPC ignored same faction %s", name );
653 return;
654 }
655 if( npc_ally ) {
656 add_msg( m_debug, "NPC ignored same faction %s", name );
657 return;
658 }
659 }
660 // discount if sound source is player, or seen by player,
661 // and listener is friendly and sound source is combat or alert only.
662 if( spriority < sounds::sound_t::alarm && g->u.sees( spos ) ) {
663 if( is_player_ally() ) {
664 add_msg( m_debug, "NPC %s ignored low priority noise that player can see", name );
665 return;
666 // discount if sound source is player, or seen by player,
667 // listener is neutral and sound type is worth investigating.
668 } else if( spriority < sounds::sound_t::destructive_activity &&
669 get_attitude_group( get_attitude() ) != attitude_group::hostile ) {
670 return;
671 }
672 }
673 // patrolling guards will investigate more readily than stationary NPCS
674 int investigate_dist = 10;
675 if( mission == NPC_MISSION_GUARD_ALLY || mission == NPC_MISSION_GUARD_PATROL ) {
676 investigate_dist = 50;
677 }
678 if( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::ignore_noise ) ) {
679 investigate_dist = 0;
680 }
681 if( ai_cache.total_danger < 1.0f ) {
682 if( spriority == sounds::sound_t::movement && !in_vehicle ) {
683 warn_about( "movement_noise", rng( 1, 10 ) * 1_minutes, description );
684 } else if( spriority > sounds::sound_t::movement ) {
685 if( ( spriority == sounds::sound_t::speech || spriority == sounds::sound_t::alert ||
686 spriority == sounds::sound_t::order ) && sound_source &&
687 !has_faction_relationship( *sound_source, npc_factions::knows_your_voice ) ) {
688 warn_about( "speech_noise", rng( 1, 10 ) * 1_minutes );
689 } else if( spriority > sounds::sound_t::activity ) {
690 warn_about( "combat_noise", rng( 1, 10 ) * 1_minutes );
691 }
692 bool should_check = rl_dist( pos(), spos ) < investigate_dist;
693 if( should_check ) {
694 const zone_manager &mgr = zone_manager::get_manager();
695 if( mgr.has( zone_type_npc_no_investigate, s_abs_pos, fac_id ) ) {
696 should_check = false;
697 } else if( mgr.has( zone_type_npc_investigate_only, my_abs_pos, fac_id ) &&
698 !mgr.has( zone_type_npc_investigate_only, s_abs_pos, fac_id ) ) {
699 should_check = false;
700 }
701 }
702 if( should_check ) {
703 add_msg( m_debug, "%s added noise at pos %d:%d", name, s_abs_pos.x, s_abs_pos.y );
704 dangerous_sound temp_sound;
705 temp_sound.abs_pos = s_abs_pos;
706 temp_sound.volume = heard_volume;
707 temp_sound.type = spriority;
708 if( !ai_cache.sound_alerts.empty() ) {
709 if( ai_cache.sound_alerts.back().abs_pos != s_abs_pos ) {
710 ai_cache.sound_alerts.push_back( temp_sound );
711 }
712 } else {
713 ai_cache.sound_alerts.push_back( temp_sound );
714 }
715 }
716 }
717 }
718}
npc::get_attitude
npc_attitude get_attitude() const
Definition: npc.cpp:3139

attitude_group get_attitude_group(npc_attitude att) const

healing_options npc::has_healing_options ( healing_options  try_to_fix)

Definition at line 1852 of file npc.cpp.

1853{
1854 healing_options can_fix;
1855 can_fix.clear_all();
1856 healing_options *fix_p = &can_fix;
1857
1858 visit_items( [&fix_p, try_to_fix]( item * node ) {
1859 const auto use = node->type->get_use( "heal" );
1860 if( use == nullptr ) {
1861 return VisitResponse::NEXT;
1862 }
1863
1864 auto &actor = dynamic_cast<const heal_actor &>( *( use->get_actor_ptr() ) );
1865 if( try_to_fix.bandage && !fix_p->bandage && actor.bandages_power > 0.0f ) {
1866 fix_p->bandage = true;
1867 }
1868 if( try_to_fix.disinfect && !fix_p->disinfect && actor.disinfectant_power > 0.0f ) {
1869 fix_p->disinfect = true;
1870 }
1871 if( try_to_fix.bleed && !fix_p->bleed && actor.bleed > 0 ) {
1872 fix_p->bleed = true;
1873 }
1874 if( try_to_fix.bite && !fix_p->bite && actor.bite > 0 ) {
1875 fix_p->bite = true;
1876 }
1877 if( try_to_fix.infect && !fix_p->infect && actor.infect > 0 ) {
1878 fix_p->infect = true;
1879 }
1880 // if we've found items for everything we're looking for, we're done
1881 if( ( !try_to_fix.bandage || fix_p->bandage ) &&
1882 ( !try_to_fix.disinfect || fix_p->disinfect ) &&
1883 ( !try_to_fix.bleed || fix_p->bleed ) &&
1884 ( !try_to_fix.bite || fix_p->bite ) &&
1885 ( !try_to_fix.infect || fix_p->infect ) ) {
1886 return VisitResponse::ABORT;
1887 }
1888
1889 return VisitResponse::NEXT;
1890 } );
1891 return can_fix;
1892}

3027 int cur_hp = hp_percentage();

3029 std::string pronoun;

3031 pronoun = _( "He " );
3032 } else {
3033 pronoun = _( "She " );
3034 }

3037 damage_info = pronoun + _( "is uninjured." );
3038 col = c_green;
3039 } else if( cur_hp >= 80 ) {
3040 damage_info = pronoun + _( "is lightly injured." );
3041 col = c_light_green;
3042 } else if( cur_hp >= 60 ) {
3043 damage_info = pronoun + _( "is moderately injured." );
3044 col = c_yellow;
3045 } else if( cur_hp >= 30 ) {
3046 damage_info = pronoun + _( "is heavily injured." );
3047 col = c_yellow;
3048 } else if( cur_hp >= 10 ) {
3049 damage_info = pronoun + _( "is severely injured." );
3050 col = c_light_red;
3051 } else {
3052 damage_info = pronoun + _( "is nearly dead!" );

3054 }

Asks how to use the item (if it has more than one use_method) and uses it.

◆ is_ally()

bool npc::is_ally ( const Character &  p) const

Definition at line 1952 of file npc.cpp.

1953{
1954 if( p.getID() == getID() ) {
1955 return true;
1956 }
1957 if( p.is_player() ) {
1958 if( my_fac && my_fac->id == faction_id( "your_followers" ) ) {
1959 return true;
1960 }
1961 if( faction_api_version < 2 ) {
1962 // legacy attitude support so let's be specific here
1963 if( attitude == NPCATT_FOLLOW || attitude == NPCATT_LEAD ||
1964 attitude == NPCATT_WAIT || mission == NPC_MISSION_ACTIVITY ||
1965 mission == NPC_MISSION_TRAVELLING || mission == NPC_MISSION_GUARD_ALLY ||
1966 has_companion_mission() ) {
1967 return true;
1968 }
1969 }
1970 } else {
1971 const npc &guy = dynamic_cast<const npc &>( p );
1972 if( my_fac && guy.get_faction() && my_fac->id == guy.get_faction()->id ) {
1973 return true;
1974 }
1975 if( faction_api_version < 2 ) {
1976 if( is_ally( g->u ) && guy.is_ally( g->u ) ) {
1977 return true;
1978 } else if( get_attitude_group( get_attitude() ) ==
1979 guy.get_attitude_group( guy.get_attitude() ) ) {
1980 return true;
1981 }
1982 }
1983 }
1984 return false;
1985}

1445 // Old submap coordinates are for the point (0, 0, 0) on local map
1446 // New ones are for submap that contains pos
1447 point old_coords;
1448 data.read( "mapx", old_coords.x );
1449 data.read( "mapy", old_coords.y );

1451 if( data.read( "omx", o ) ) {
1452 old_coords.x += o * OMAPX * 2;
1453 }
1454 if( data.read( "omy", o ) ) {
1455 old_coords.y += o * OMAPY * 2;
1456 }

◆ method_of_attack()

npc_action npc::method_of_attack ( )

Definition at line 1320 of file npcmove.cpp.

1321{
1322 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
1323 Creature *critter = current_target();
1324 if( critter == nullptr ) {
1325 // This function shouldn't be called...
1326 debugmsg( "Ran npc::method_of_attack without a target!" );
1327 return npc_pause;
1328 }
1329
1330 tripoint tar = critter->pos();
1331 int dist = rl_dist( pos(), tar );
1332 double danger = evaluate_enemy( *critter );
1333 const bool has_los = clear_shot_reach( pos(), tar, false );
1334 const bool same_z = tar.z == pos().z;
1335
1336 // TODO: Change the in_vehicle check to actual "are we driving" check
1337 const bool dont_move = in_vehicle || rules.engagement == combat_engagement::NO_MOVE ||
1338 rules.engagement == combat_engagement::FREE_FIRE;
1339 // NPCs engage in free fire can move to avoid allies, but not if they're in a vehicle
1340 const bool dont_move_ff = in_vehicle || rules.engagement == combat_engagement::NO_MOVE;
1341
1342 // if there's enough of a threat to be here, power up the combat CBMs
1343 activate_combat_cbms();
1344
1345 int ups_charges = charges_of( itype_UPS );
1346
1347 // get any suitable modes excluding melee, any forbidden to NPCs and those without ammo
1348 // if we require a silent weapon inappropriate modes are also removed
1349 // except in emergency only fire bursts if danger > 0.5 and don't shoot at all at harmless targets
1350 std::vector<std::pair<gun_mode_id, gun_mode>> modes;
1351 if( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_guns ) || !is_player_ally() ) {
1352 for( const auto &e : weapon.gun_all_modes() ) {
1353 modes.push_back( e );
1354 }
1355
1356 modes.erase( std::remove_if( modes.begin(), modes.end(),
1357 [&]( const std::pair<gun_mode_id, gun_mode> &e ) {
1358
1359 const auto &m = e.second;
1360 return m.melee() || m.flags.count( "NPC_AVOID" ) ||
1361 !m->ammo_sufficient( m.qty ) || !can_use( *m.target ) ||
1362 m->get_gun_ups_drain() > ups_charges ||
1363 ( ( danger <= ( m.qty == 1 ? 3.0 : 15.0 ) ) && !emergency() ) ||
1364 ( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_silent ) && is_player_ally() &&
1365 !m.target->is_silent() );
1366
1367 } ), modes.end() );
1368 }
1369
1370 // prefer modes that result in more total damage
1371 std::stable_sort( modes.begin(),
1372 modes.end(), [&]( const std::pair<gun_mode_id, gun_mode> &lhs,
1373 const std::pair<gun_mode_id, gun_mode> &rhs ) {
1374 return ( lhs.second->gun_damage().total_damage() * lhs.second.qty ) >
1375 ( rhs.second->gun_damage().total_damage() * rhs.second.qty );
1376 } );
1377
1378 const int cur_recoil = recoil_total();
1379 // modes outside confident range should always be the last option(s)
1380 std::stable_sort( modes.begin(),
1381 modes.end(), [&]( const std::pair<gun_mode_id, gun_mode> &lhs,
1382 const std::pair<gun_mode_id, gun_mode> &rhs ) {
1383 return ( confident_gun_mode_range( lhs.second, cur_recoil ) >= dist ) >
1384 ( confident_gun_mode_range( rhs.second, cur_recoil ) >= dist );
1385 } );
1386
1387 if( emergency() && alt_attack() ) {
1388 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is trying an alternate attack", disp_name() );
1389 return npc_noop;
1390 }
1391
1392 // reach attacks are silent and consume no ammo so prefer these if available
1393 int reach_range = weapon.reach_range( *this );
1394 if( !trigdist ) {
1395 if( reach_range > 1 && reach_range >= dist && clear_shot_reach( pos(), tar ) ) {
1396 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is trying a reach attack", disp_name() );
1397 return npc_reach_attack;
1398 }
1399 } else {
1400 if( reach_range > 1 && reach_range >= std::round( trig_dist( pos(), tar ) ) &&
1401 clear_shot_reach( pos(), tar ) ) {
1402 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is trying a reach attack", disp_name() );
1403 return npc_reach_attack;
1404 }
1405 }
1406
1407 // if the best mode is within the confident range try for a shot
1408 if( !modes.empty() && sees( *critter ) && has_los &&
1409 confident_gun_mode_range( modes[ 0 ].second, cur_recoil ) >= dist ) {
1410 if( cbm_weapon_index > 0 && !weapon.ammo_sufficient() && can_reload_current() ) {
1411 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is reloading", disp_name() );
1412 return npc_reload;
1413 }
1414
1415 if( wont_hit_friend( tar, weapon, false ) ) {
1416 weapon.gun_set_mode( modes[ 0 ].first );
1417 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is trying to shoot someone", disp_name() );
1418 return npc_shoot;
1419
1420 } else {
1421 if( !dont_move_ff ) {
1422 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is trying to avoid friendly fire", disp_name() );
1423 return npc_avoid_friendly_fire;
1424 }
1425 }
1426 }
1427
1428 if( dist == 1 && same_z ) {
1429 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is trying a melle attack", disp_name() );
1430 return npc_melee;
1431 }
1432
1433 // don't mess with CBM weapons
1434 if( cbm_weapon_index < 0 ) {
1435 // TODO: Add a time check now that wielding takes a lot of time
1436 if( wield_better_weapon() ) {
1437 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is changing weapons", disp_name() );
1438 return npc_noop;
1439 }
1440
1441 if( !weapon.ammo_sufficient() && can_reload_current() ) {
1442 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is reloading", disp_name() );
1443 return npc_reload;
1444 }
1445 }
1446
1447 // TODO: Needs a check for transparent but non-passable tiles on the way
1448 if( !modes.empty() && sees( *critter ) && aim_per_move( weapon, recoil ) > 0 &&
1449 confident_shoot_range( weapon, get_most_accurate_sight( weapon ) ) >= dist ) {
1450 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is aiming", disp_name() );
1451 if( critter->is_player() && player_character.sees( *this ) ) {
1452 add_msg( m_bad, _( "%s takes aim at you!" ), disp_name() );
1453 }
1454 return npc_aim;
1455 }
1456 add_msg( m_debug, "%s can't figure out what to do", disp_name() );
1457 return ( dont_move || !same_z ) ? npc_undecided : npc_melee;
1458}
trigdist
bool trigdist
Circular distances.

◆ move()

void npc::move ( )

Definition at line 713 of file npcmove.cpp.

714{
715 // don't just return from this function without doing something
716 // that will eventually subtract moves, or change the NPC to a different type of action.
717 // because this will result in an infinite loop
718 if( attitude == NPCATT_FLEE ) {
719 set_attitude( NPCATT_FLEE_TEMP ); // Only run for so many hours
720 } else if( attitude == NPCATT_FLEE_TEMP && !has_effect( effect_npc_flee_player ) ) {
721 set_attitude( NPCATT_NULL );
722 }
723 regen_ai_cache();
724 adjust_power_cbms();
725 // NPCs under operation should just stay still
726 if( activity.id() == activity_id( "ACT_OPERATION" ) ) {
727 execute_action( npc_player_activity );
728 return;
729 }
730
731 npc_action action = npc_undecided;
732
733 static const std::string no_target_str = "none";
734 const Creature *target = current_target();
735 const std::string &target_name = target != nullptr ? target->disp_name() : no_target_str;
736 add_msg( m_debug, "NPC %s: target = %s, danger = %.1f, range = %d",
737 name, target_name, ai_cache.danger, weapon.is_gun() ? confident_shoot_range( weapon,
738 recoil_total() ) : weapon.reach_range( *this ) );
739
740 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
741 //faction opinion determines if it should consider you hostile
742 if( !is_enemy() && guaranteed_hostile() && sees( player_character ) ) {
743 if( is_player_ally() ) {
744 mutiny();
745 }
746 add_msg( m_debug, "NPC %s turning hostile because is guaranteed_hostile()", name );
747 if( op_of_u.fear > 10 + personality.aggression + personality.bravery ) {
748 set_attitude( NPCATT_FLEE_TEMP ); // We don't want to take u on!
749 } else {
750 set_attitude( NPCATT_KILL ); // Yeah, we think we could take you!
751 }
752 }
753
754 /* This bypasses the logic to determine the npc action, but this all needs to be rewritten
755 * anyway.
756 * NPC won't avoid dangerous terrain while accompanying the player inside a vehicle to keep
757 * them from inadvertently getting themselves run over and/or cause vehicle related errors.
758 * NPCs flee from uncontained fires within 3 tiles
759 */
760 if( !in_vehicle && ( sees_dangerous_field( pos() ) || has_effect( effect_npc_fire_bad ) ) ) {
761 if( sees_dangerous_field( pos() ) ) {
762 path.clear();
763 }
764 const tripoint escape_dir = good_escape_direction( sees_dangerous_field( pos() ) );
765 if( escape_dir != pos() ) {
766 move_to( escape_dir );
767 return;
768 }
769 }
770
771 // TODO: Place player-aiding actions here, with a weight
772
773 /* NPCs are fairly suicidal so at this point we will do a quick check to see if
774 * something nasty is going to happen.
775 */
776
777 if( is_enemy() && vehicle_danger( avoidance_vehicles_radius ) > 0 ) {
778 // TODO: Think about how this actually needs to work, for now assume flee from player
779 ai_cache.target = g->shared_from( player_character );
780 }
781
782 map &here = get_map();
783 if( !ai_cache.dangerous_explosives.empty() ) {
784 action = npc_escape_explosion;
785 } else if( target == &player_character && attitude == NPCATT_FLEE_TEMP ) {
786 action = method_of_fleeing();
787 } else if( has_effect( effect_npc_run_away ) ) {
788 action = method_of_fleeing();
789 } else if( has_effect( effect_asthma ) && ( has_charges( itype_inhaler, 1 ) ||
790 has_charges( itype_oxygen_tank, 1 ) ||
791 has_charges( itype_smoxygen_tank, 1 ) ) ) {
792 action = npc_heal;
793 } else if( target != nullptr && ai_cache.danger > 0 ) {
794 action = method_of_attack();
795 } else if( !ai_cache.sound_alerts.empty() && !is_walking_with() ) {
796 tripoint cur_s_abs_pos = ai_cache.s_abs_pos;
797 if( !ai_cache.guard_pos ) {
798 ai_cache.guard_pos = here.getabs( pos() );
799 }
800 if( ai_cache.sound_alerts.size() > 1 ) {
801 std::sort( ai_cache.sound_alerts.begin(), ai_cache.sound_alerts.end(),
802 compare_sound_alert );
803 if( ai_cache.sound_alerts.size() > 10 ) {
804 ai_cache.sound_alerts.resize( 10 );
805 }
806 }
807 action = npc_investigate_sound;
808 if( ai_cache.sound_alerts.front().abs_pos != cur_s_abs_pos ) {
809 ai_cache.stuck = 0;
810 ai_cache.s_abs_pos = ai_cache.sound_alerts.front().abs_pos;
811 } else if( ai_cache.stuck > 10 ) {
812 ai_cache.stuck = 0;
813 if( ai_cache.sound_alerts.size() == 1 ) {
814 ai_cache.sound_alerts.clear();
815 action = npc_return_to_guard_pos;
816 } else {
817 ai_cache.s_abs_pos = ai_cache.sound_alerts.at( 1 ).abs_pos;
818 }
819 }
820 if( action == npc_investigate_sound ) {
821 add_msg( m_debug, "NPC %s: investigating sound at x(%d) y(%d)", name,
822 ai_cache.s_abs_pos.x, ai_cache.s_abs_pos.y );
823 }
824 } else if( ai_cache.sound_alerts.empty() && ai_cache.guard_pos ) {
825 tripoint return_guard_pos = *ai_cache.guard_pos;
826 add_msg( m_debug, "NPC %s: returning to guard spot at x(%d) y(%d)", name,
827 return_guard_pos.x, return_guard_pos.y );
828 action = npc_return_to_guard_pos;
829 } else {
830 // No present danger
831 deactivate_combat_cbms();
832
833 action = address_needs();
834 print_action( "address_needs %s", action );
835
836 if( action == npc_undecided ) {
837 action = address_player();
838 print_action( "address_player %s", action );
839 }
840 }
841
842 // check if in vehicle before doing any other follow activities
843 if( action == npc_undecided && is_walking_with() && player_character.in_vehicle && !in_vehicle ) {
844 action = npc_follow_embarked;
845 }
846
847 if( action == npc_undecided && is_walking_with() && rules.has_flag( ally_rule::follow_close ) &&
848 rl_dist( pos(), player_character.pos() ) > follow_distance() ) {
849 action = npc_follow_player;
850 }
851
852 if( action == npc_undecided && attitude == NPCATT_ACTIVITY ) {
853 if( has_stashed_activity() ) {
854 if( !check_outbounds_activity( get_stashed_activity(), true ) ) {
855 assign_stashed_activity();
856 } else {
857 // wait a turn, because next turn, the object of our activity
858 // may have been loaded in.
859 set_moves( 0 );
860 }
861 return;
862 }
863 std::vector<tripoint> activity_route = get_auto_move_route();
864 if( !activity_route.empty() && !has_destination_activity() ) {
865 tripoint final_destination;
866 if( destination_point ) {
867 final_destination = here.getlocal( *destination_point );
868 } else {
869 final_destination = activity_route.back();
870 }
871 update_path( final_destination );
872 if( !path.empty() ) {
873 move_to_next();
874 return;
875 }
876 }
877 if( has_destination_activity() ) {
878 start_destination_activity();
879 action = npc_player_activity;
880 } else if( has_player_activity() ) {
881 action = npc_player_activity;
882 }
883 }
884 if( action == npc_undecided ) {
885 // an interrupted activity can cause this situation. stops allied NPCs zooming off
886 // like random NPCs
887 if( attitude == NPCATT_ACTIVITY && !activity ) {
888 revert_after_activity();
889 if( is_ally( player_character ) ) {
890 attitude = NPCATT_FOLLOW;
891 mission = NPC_MISSION_NULL;
892 }
893 }
894 if( assigned_camp && attitude != NPCATT_ACTIVITY ) {
895 if( has_job() && calendar::once_every( 10_minutes ) && find_job_to_perform() ) {
896 action = npc_player_activity;
897 } else {
898 action = npc_worker_downtime;
899 goal = global_omt_location();
900 }
901 }
902 if( is_stationary( true ) && !assigned_camp ) {
903 // if we're in a vehicle, stay in the vehicle
904 if( in_vehicle ) {
905 action = npc_pause;
906 goal = global_omt_location();
907 } else {
908 action = goal == global_omt_location() ? npc_pause : npc_goto_destination;
909 }
910 } else if( has_new_items && scan_new_items() ) {
911 return;
912 } else if( !fetching_item ) {
913 find_item();
914 print_action( "find_item %s", action );
915 } else if( assigned_camp ) {
916 // this should be covered above, but justincase to stop them zooming away.
917 action = npc_pause;
918 }
919
920 // check if in vehicle before rushing off to fetch things
921 if( is_walking_with() && player_character.in_vehicle ) {
922 action = npc_follow_embarked;
923 } else if( fetching_item ) {
924 // Set to true if find_item() found something
925 action = npc_pickup;
926 } else if( is_following() ) {
927 // No items, so follow the player?
928 action = npc_follow_player;
929 }
930 // Friendly NPCs who are followers/ doing tasks for the player should never get here.
931 // This will revert them to a dynamic NPC state.
932 if( action == npc_undecided ) {
933 // Do our long-term action
934 action = long_term_goal_action();
935 print_action( "long_term_goal_action %s", action );
936 }
937 }
938
939 /* Sometimes we'll be following the player at this point, but close enough that
940 * "following" means standing still. If that's the case, if there are any
941 * monsters around, we should attack them after all!
942 *
943 * If we are following a embarked player and we are in a vehicle then shoot anyway
944 * as we are most likely riding shotgun
945 */
946 if( ai_cache.danger > 0 && target != nullptr &&
947 (
948 ( action == npc_follow_embarked && in_vehicle ) ||
949 ( action == npc_follow_player &&
950 ( rl_dist( pos(), player_character.pos() ) <= follow_distance() ||
951 posz() != player_character.posz() ) )
952 ) ) {
953 action = method_of_attack();
954 }
955
956 add_msg( m_debug, "%s chose action %s.", name, npc_action_name( action ) );
957 execute_action( action );
958}
Character::destination_point
cata::optional< tripoint > destination_point
Definition: character.h:1518

2723{
2724 if( spheres.empty() ) {
2725 return;
2726 }
2727
2728 tripoint minp( pos() );
2729 tripoint maxp( pos() );
2730
2731 for( const auto &elem : spheres ) {
2732 minp.x = std::min( minp.x, elem.center.x - elem.radius );
2733 minp.y = std::min( minp.y, elem.center.y - elem.radius );
2734 maxp.x = std::max( maxp.x, elem.center.x + elem.radius );
2735 maxp.y = std::max( maxp.y, elem.center.y + elem.radius );
2736 }
2737
2738 const tripoint_range<tripoint> range( minp, maxp );
2739
2740 std::vector<tripoint> escape_points;
2741
2742 map &here = get_map();
2743 std::copy_if( range.begin(), range.end(), std::back_inserter( escape_points ),
2744 [&here]( const tripoint & elem ) {
2745 return here.passable( elem );
2746 } );
2747
2748 cata::sort_by_rating( escape_points.begin(), escape_points.end(), [&]( const tripoint & elem ) {
2749 const int danger = std::accumulate( spheres.begin(), spheres.end(), 0,
2750 [&]( const int sum, const sphere & s ) {
2751 return sum + std::max( s.radius - rl_dist( elem, s.center ), 0 );
2752 } );
2753
2754 const int distance = rl_dist( pos(), elem );
2755 const int move_cost = here.move_cost( elem );
2756
2757 return std::make_tuple( danger, distance, move_cost );
2758 } );
2759

2761 update_path( elem, no_bashing );
2762
2763 if( elem == pos() || !path.empty() ) {
2764 break;
2765 }
2766 }
2767
2768 if( !path.empty() ) {
2769 move_to_next();
2770 } else {
2771 move_pause();
2772 }

void npc::move_away_from ( const tripoint &  p,
bool  no_bash_atk = false,
std::set< tripoint > *  nomove = nullptr 
)

Definition at line 2535 of file npcmove.cpp.

2536{
2537 tripoint best_pos = pos();
2538 int best = -1;
2539 int chance = 2;
2540 map &here = get_map();
2541 for( const tripoint &p : here.points_in_radius( pos(), 1 ) ) {
2542 if( nomove != nullptr && nomove->find( p ) != nomove->end() ) {
2543 continue;
2544 }
2545
2546 if( p == pos() ) {
2547 continue;
2548 }
2549
2550 if( p == get_player_character().pos() ) {
2551 continue;
2552 }
2553
2554 const int cost = here.combined_movecost( pos(), p );
2555 if( cost <= 0 ) {
2556 continue;
2557 }
2558
2559 const int dst = std::abs( p.x - pt.x ) + std::abs( p.y - pt.y ) + std::abs( p.z - pt.z );
2560 const int val = dst * 1000 / cost;
2561 if( val > best && can_move_to( p, no_bash_atk ) ) {
2562 best_pos = p;
2563 best = val;
2564 chance = 2;
2565 } else if( ( val == best && one_in( chance ) ) && can_move_to( p, no_bash_atk ) ) {
2566 best_pos = p;
2567 best = val;
2568 chance++;
2569 }
2570 }
2571
2572 move_to( best_pos, no_bash_atk, nomove );
2573}

2337

2342 }
2343
2344 // Boarding moving vehicles is fine, unboarding isn't
2345 bool moved = false;

2347 const optional_vpart_position ovp = here.veh_at( p );
2348 if( vp->vehicle().is_moving() &&
2349 ( veh_pointer_or_null( ovp ) != veh_pointer_or_null( vp ) ||
2350 !ovp.part_with_feature( VPFLAG_BOARDABLE, true ) ) ) {
2351 move_pause();

2353 }
2354 }
2355

2357 // Z-level move
2358 // For now just teleport to the destination
2359 // TODO: Make it properly find the tile to move to
2360 if( is_mounted() ) {
2361 move_pause();
2362 return;
2363 }
2364 moves -= 100;
2365 moved = true;
2366 } else if( here.passable( p ) && !here.has_flag( "DOOR", p ) ) {
2367 bool diag = trigdist && posx() != p.x && posy() != p.y;
2368 if( is_mounted() ) {
2369 const double base_moves = run_cost( here.combined_movecost( pos(), p ),
2370 diag ) * 100.0 / mounted_creature->get_speed();
2371 const double encumb_moves = get_weight() / 4800.0_gram;
2372 moves -= static_cast<int>( std::ceil( base_moves + encumb_moves ) );
2373 if( mounted_creature->has_flag( MF_RIDEABLE_MECH ) ) {
2374 mounted_creature->use_mech_power( -1 );
2375 }
2376 } else {
2377 moves -= run_cost( here.combined_movecost( pos(), p ), diag );
2378 }
2379 moved = true;
2380 } else if( here.open_door( p, !here.is_outside( pos() ), true ) ) {
2381 if( !is_hallucination() ) { // hallucinations don't open doors
2382 here.open_door( p, !here.is_outside( pos() ) );
2383 moves -= 100;
2384 } else { // hallucinations teleport through doors
2385 moves -= 100;
2386 moved = true;
2387 }
2388 } else if( get_dex() > 1 && here.has_flag_ter_or_furn( "CLIMBABLE", p ) ) {
2389 ///\EFFECT_DEX_NPC increases chance to climb CLIMBABLE furniture or terrain
2390 int climb = get_dex();
2391 if( one_in( climb ) ) {
2392 add_msg_if_npc( m_neutral, _( "%1$s tries to climb the %2$s but slips." ), name,
2393 here.tername( p ) );
2394 moves -= 400;
2395 } else {
2396 add_msg_if_npc( m_neutral, _( "%1$s climbs over the %2$s." ), name, here.tername( p ) );
2397 moves -= ( 500 - ( rng( 0, climb ) * 20 ) );
2398 moved = true;
2399 }
2400 } else if( !no_bashing && smash_ability() > 0 && here.is_bashable( p ) &&
2401 here.bash_rating( smash_ability(), p ) > 0 ) {
2402 moves -= !is_armed() ? 80 : weapon.attack_cost() * 0.8;
2403 here.bash( p, smash_ability() );
2404 } else {
2405 if( attitude == NPCATT_MUG ||
2406 attitude == NPCATT_KILL ||
2407 attitude == NPCATT_WAIT_FOR_LEAVE ) {
2408 set_attitude( NPCATT_FLEE_TEMP );
2409 }
2410
2411 moves = 0;
2412 }
2413
2414 if( moved ) {
2415 const tripoint old_pos = pos();
2416 setpos( p );
2417 if( old_pos.x - p.x < 0 ) {
2418 facing = FD_RIGHT;
2419 } else {
2420 facing = FD_LEFT;
2421 }
2422 if( is_mounted() ) {
2423 if( mounted_creature->pos() != pos() ) {
2424 mounted_creature->setpos( pos() );
2425 mounted_creature->facing = facing;
2426 mounted_creature->process_triggers();
2427 here.creature_in_field( *mounted_creature );
2428 here.creature_on_trap( *mounted_creature );
2429 }
2430 }
2431 if( here.has_flag( "UNSTABLE", pos() ) ) {
2432 add_effect( effect_bouldering, 1_turns, num_bp );
2433 } else if( has_effect( effect_bouldering ) ) {
2434 remove_effect( effect_bouldering );
2435 }
2436
2437 if( here.has_flag_ter_or_furn( TFLAG_NO_SIGHT, pos() ) ) {
2438 add_effect( effect_no_sight, 1_turns, num_bp );
2439 } else if( has_effect( effect_no_sight ) ) {
2440 remove_effect( effect_no_sight );
2441 }
2442
2443 if( in_vehicle ) {
2444 here.unboard_vehicle( old_pos );
2445 }
2446
2447 // Close doors behind self (if you can)
2448 if( ( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::close_doors ) && is_player_ally() ) && !is_hallucination() ) {
2449 doors::close_door( here, *this, old_pos );
2450 }
2451
2452 if( here.veh_at( p ).part_with_feature( VPFLAG_BOARDABLE, true ) ) {
2453 here.board_vehicle( p, this );
2454 }
2455
2456 here.creature_on_trap( *this );
2457 here.creature_in_field( *this );
2458 }
2459}

◆ on_load()

void npc::on_load ( )

Retroactively update npc.

Definition at line 2658 of file npc.cpp.

2659{
2660 const auto advance_effects = [&]( const time_duration & elapsed_dur ) {
2661 for( auto &elem : *effects ) {
2662 for( auto &_effect_it : elem.second ) {
2663 effect &e = _effect_it.second;
2664 const time_duration &time_left = e.get_duration();
2665 if( time_left > 1_turns ) {
2666 if( time_left < elapsed_dur ) {
2667 e.set_duration( 1_turns );
2668 } else {
2669 e.set_duration( time_left - elapsed_dur );
2670 }
2671 }
2672 }
2673 }
2674 };
2675 // Cap at some reasonable number, say 2 days
2676 const time_duration dt = std::min( calendar::turn - last_updated, 2_days );
2677 // TODO: Sleeping, healing etc.
2678 last_updated = calendar::turn;
2679 time_point cur = calendar::turn - dt;
2680 add_msg( m_debug, "on_load() by %s, %d turns", name, to_turns<int>( dt ) );
2681 // First update with 30 minute granularity, then 5 minutes, then turns
2682 for( ; cur < calendar::turn - 30_minutes; cur += 30_minutes + 1_turns ) {
2683 update_body( cur, cur + 30_minutes );
2684 advance_effects( 30_minutes );
2685 }
2686 for( ; cur < calendar::turn - 5_minutes; cur += 5_minutes + 1_turns ) {
2687 update_body( cur, cur + 5_minutes );
2688 advance_effects( 5_minutes );
2689 }
2690 for( ; cur < calendar::turn; cur += 1_turns ) {
2691 update_body( cur, cur + 1_turns );
2692 process_effects();
2693 }
2694
2695 if( dt > 0_turns ) {
2696 // This ensures food is properly rotten at load
2697 // Otherwise NPCs try to eat rotten food and fail
2698 process_items();
2699 // give NPCs that are doing activities a pile of moves
2700 if( has_destination() || activity ) {
2701 mod_moves( to_moves<int>( dt ) );
2702 }
2703 }
2704
2705 // Not necessarily true, but it's not a bad idea to set this
2706 has_new_items = true;
2707
2708 // for spawned npcs
2709 if( g->m.has_flag( "UNSTABLE", pos() ) ) {
2710 add_effect( effect_bouldering, 1_turns, num_bp );
2711 } else if( has_effect( effect_bouldering ) ) {
2712 remove_effect( effect_bouldering );
2713 }
2714 if( g->m.veh_at( pos() ).part_with_feature( VPFLAG_BOARDABLE, true ) && !in_vehicle ) {
2715 g->m.board_vehicle( pos(), this );
2716 }

2719 mounted_creature = g->shared_from( *mon );
2720 } else {
2721 add_msg( m_debug, "NPC is meant to be riding, though the mount is not found when %s is loaded",
2722 disp_name() );
2723 }
2724 }

◆ opinion_text()

std::string npc::opinion_text ( ) const

2296{
2297 std::string ret;
2298 if( op_of_u.trust <= -10 ) {
2299 ret += _( "Completely untrusting" );
2300 } else if( op_of_u.trust <= -6 ) {
2301 ret += _( "Very untrusting" );

2305 ret += _( "Uneasy" );

2307 ret += _( "Trusting" );

2319 ret += _( "Thinks you're harmless" );
2320 } else if( op_of_u.fear <= -3 ) {
2321 ret += _( "Unafraid" );
2322 } else if( op_of_u.fear <= 2 ) {
2323 ret += _( "Wary" );
2324 } else if( op_of_u.fear <= 5 ) {
2325 ret += _( "Afraid" );
2326 } else if( op_of_u.fear < 10 ) {
2327 ret += _( "Very afraid" );
2328 } else {
2329 ret += _( "Terrified" );
2330 }
2331
2332 ret += string_format( _( " (Fear: %d); " ), op_of_u.fear );
2333
2334 if( op_of_u.value <= -10 ) {
2335 ret += _( "Considers you a major liability" );
2336 } else if( op_of_u.value <= -6 ) {
2337 ret += _( "Considers you a burden" );
2338 } else if( op_of_u.value <= -3 ) {
2339 ret += _( "Considers you an annoyance" );
2340 } else if( op_of_u.value <= 2 ) {
2341 ret += _( "Doesn't care about you" );
2342 } else if( op_of_u.value <= 5 ) {
2343 ret += _( "Values your presence" );
2344 } else if( op_of_u.value < 10 ) {
2345 ret += _( "Treasures you" );
2346 } else {
2347 ret += _( "Best Friends Forever!" );
2348 }
2349
2350 ret += string_format( _( " (Value: %d); " ), op_of_u.value );
2351
2352 if( op_of_u.anger <= -10 ) {
2353 ret += _( "You can do no wrong!" );
2354 } else if( op_of_u.anger <= -6 ) {
2355 ret += _( "You're good people" );
2356 } else if( op_of_u.anger <= -3 ) {
2357 ret += _( "Thinks well of you" );
2358 } else if( op_of_u.anger <= 2 ) {
2359 ret += _( "Ambivalent" );
2360 } else if( op_of_u.anger <= 5 ) {
2361 ret += _( "Pissed off" );
2362 } else if( op_of_u.anger < 10 ) {
2363 ret += _( "Angry" );
2364 } else {
2365 ret += _( "About to kill you" );
2366 }
2367
2368 ret += string_format( _( " (Anger: %d)" ), op_of_u.anger );
2369
2370 return ret;
2371}

3020 } else if( cant_reach && path.empty() ) {
3021 add_msg( m_debug, "Can't find path" );
3022 // This can happen, always do something
3023 fetching_item = false;
3024 move_pause();

3026 }
3027

3033 }
3034

3036 // Last chance: plant harvest
3037 if( here.is_harvestable( wanted_item_pos ) ) {
3038 here.examine( *this, wanted_item_pos );
3039 // Note: we didn't actually pick up anything, just spawned items
3040 // but we want the item picker to find new items
3041 fetching_item = false;
3042 return;
3043 }
3044 }
3045 Character &player_character = get_player_character();

3048 if( u_see ) {
3049 if( picked_up.size() == 1 ) {
3050 add_msg( _( "%1$s picks up a %2$s." ), name, picked_up.front().tname() );
3051 } else if( picked_up.size() == 2 ) {
3052 add_msg( _( "%1$s picks up a %2$s and a %3$s." ), name, picked_up.front().tname(),
3053 picked_up.back().tname() );
3054 } else if( picked_up.size() > 2 ) {
3055 add_msg( _( "%s picks up several items." ), name );
3056 } else {
3057 add_msg( _( "%s looks around nervously, as if searching for something." ), name );
3058 }
3059 }
3060
3061 for( auto &it : picked_up ) {
3062 int itval = value( it );
3063 if( itval < worst_item_value ) {
3064 worst_item_value = itval;
3065 }
3066 i_add( it );
3067 }
3068
3069 moves -= 100;
3070 fetching_item = false;
3071 has_new_items = true;

◆ place_on_map()

void npc::place_on_map ( )

Places the NPC on the map.

This update its pos values to fit the current offset of map (g->levx, g->levy). If the square on the map where the NPC would go is not empty a spiral search for an empty square around it is performed.

Definition at line 744 of file npc.cpp.

745{
746 // The global absolute position (in map squares) of the npc is *always*
747 // "submap_coords.x * SEEX + posx() % SEEX" (analog for y).
748 // The main map assumes that pos is in its own (local to the main map)
749 // coordinate system. We have to change pos to match that assumption
750 const point dm( submap_coords + point( -g->get_levx(), -g->get_levy() ) );
751 const point offset( position.x % SEEX, position.y % SEEY );
752 // value of "submap_coords.x * SEEX + posx()" is unchanged
753 setpos( tripoint( offset.x + dm.x * SEEX, offset.y + dm.y * SEEY, posz() ) );
754
755 if( g->is_empty( pos() ) || is_mounted() ) {
756 return;
757 }
758
759 for( const tripoint &p : closest_points_first( pos(), SEEX + 1 ) ) {
760 if( g->is_empty( p ) ) {
761 setpos( p );
762 return;
763 }
764 }
765
766 debugmsg( "Failed to place NPC in a valid location near (%d,%d,%d)", posx(), posy(), posz() );
767}

References closest_points_first(), debugmsg, g, Character::is_mounted(), Character::pos(), Character::position, Character::posx(), Character::posy(), Character::posz(), SEEX, SEEY, setpos(), submap_coords, point::x, tripoint::x, point::y, and tripoint::y.

◆ print_info()

int npc::print_info ( const catacurses::window &  w,
int  vStart,
int  vLines,
int  column 
) const
overridevirtual

Write information about this creature.

Parameters
wthe window to print the text into.
vStartvertical start to print, that means the first line to print.
vLinesnumber of lines to print at most (printing less is fine).
columnhorizontal start to print (column), horizontal end is one character before the right border of the window (to keep the border).
Returns
The line just behind the last printed line, that means multiple calls to this can be stacked, the return value is acceptable as vStart for the next call without creating empty lines or overwriting lines.

Reimplemented from Character.

Definition at line 2236 of file npc.cpp.

2237{
2238 const int last_line = line + vLines;
2239 const int iWidth = getmaxx( w ) - 2;
2240 // First line of w is the border; the next 4 are terrain info, and after that
2241 // is a blank line. w is 13 characters tall, and we can't use the last one
2242 // because it's a border as well; so we have lines 6 through 11.
2243 // w is also 48 characters wide - 2 characters for border = 46 characters for us
2244 mvwprintz( w, point( column, line++ ), c_white, _( "NPC: " ) );
2245 wprintz( w, basic_symbol_color(), name );
2246
2247 if( sees( g->u ) ) {
2248 mvwprintz( w, point( column, line++ ), c_yellow, _( "Aware of your presence!" ) );
2249 }
2250
2251 if( is_armed() ) {
2252 trim_and_print( w, point( column, line++ ), iWidth, c_red, _( "Wielding a %s" ), weapon.tname() );
2253 }
2254
2255 const auto enumerate_print = [ w, last_line, column, iWidth, &line ]( const std::string & str_in,
2256 nc_color color ) {
2257 const std::vector<std::string> folded = foldstring( str_in, iWidth );
2258 for( auto it = folded.begin(); it < folded.end() && line < last_line; ++it, ++line ) {
2259 trim_and_print( w, point( column, line ), iWidth, color, *it );
2260 }
2261 };
2262

2264 return it.tname();
2265 } );
2266 if( !worn_str.empty() ) {
2267 const std::string wearing = _( "Wearing: " ) + worn_str;
2268 enumerate_print( wearing, c_light_blue );
2269 }
2270
2271 // as of now, visibility of mutations is between 0 and 10
2272 // 10 perception and 10 distance would see all mutations - cap 0
2273 // 10 perception and 30 distance - cap 5, some mutations visible
2274 // 3 perception and 3 distance would see all mutations - cap 0
2275 // 3 perception and 15 distance - cap 5, some mutations visible
2276 // 3 perception and 20 distance would be barely able to discern huge antlers on a person - cap 10
2277 const int per = g->u.get_per();
2278 const int dist = rl_dist( g->u.pos(), pos() );
2279 int visibility_cap;
2280 if( per <= 1 ) {
2281 visibility_cap = INT_MAX;
2282 } else {
2283 visibility_cap = std::round( dist * dist / 20.0 / ( per - 1 ) );
2284 }
2285
2286 const auto trait_str = visible_mutations( visibility_cap );
2287 if( !trait_str.empty() ) {
2288 const std::string mutations = _( "Traits: " ) + trait_str;
2289 enumerate_print( mutations, c_green );
2290 }
2291
2292 return line;
2293}

◆ process_turn()

void npc::process_turn ( )
overridevirtual

Handles end-of-turn processing.

Reimplemented from Character.

Definition at line 2801 of file npc.cpp.

2802{
2803 player::process_turn();
2804
2805 // NPCs shouldn't be using stamina, but if they have, set it back to max
2806 if( calendar::once_every( 1_minutes ) && get_stamina() < get_stamina_max() ) {
2807 set_stamina( get_stamina_max() );
2808 }
2809
2810 if( is_player_ally() && calendar::once_every( 1_hours ) &&
2811 get_kcal_percent() > 0.95 && get_thirst() < thirst_levels::very_thirsty && op_of_u.trust < 5 ) {
2812 // Friends who are well fed will like you more
2813 // 24 checks per day, best case chance at trust 0 is 1 in 48 for +1 trust per 2 days
2814 float trust_chance = 5 - op_of_u.trust;
2815 // Penalize for bad impression
2816 // TODO: Penalize for traits and actions (especially murder, unless NPC is psycho)
2817 int op_penalty = std::max( 0, op_of_u.anger ) +
2818 std::max( 0, -op_of_u.value ) +
2819 std::max( 0, op_of_u.fear );
2820 // Being barely hungry and thirsty, not in pain and not wounded means good care
2821 int state_penalty = ( max_stored_kcal() - get_stored_kcal() ) / 10 + get_thirst()
2822 + ( 100 - hp_percentage() ) + get_pain();
2823 if( x_in_y( trust_chance, 240 + 10 * op_penalty + state_penalty ) ) {
2824 op_of_u.trust++;
2825 }
2826
2827 // TODO: Similar checks for fear and anger
2828 }
2829
2830 // TODO: Add decreasing trust/value/etc. here when player doesn't provide food
2831 // TODO: Make NPCs leave the player if there's a path out of map and player is sleeping/unseen/etc.
2832}

2742 // NPCs don't like queries - most of them are in the form of "Do you want to get hurt?".
2743 return false;
2744}

2405{
2406 //The NPC got into an infinite loop, in game.cpp -monmove() - a debugmsg just popped up
2407 // informing player of this.
2408 // put them to sleep and reboot their brain.
2409 // they can be woken up by the player, and if their brain is fixed, great,
2410 // if not, they will faint again, and the NPC can be kept asleep until the bug is fixed.

1679{
1680 // non-allied NPCs don't consume resources to recharge
1681 if( !is_player_ally() ) {
1682 mod_power_level( get_max_power_level() );
1683 return true;
1684 }
1685
1686 for( bionic_id &bid : get_fueled_bionics() ) {
1687 if( has_active_bionic( bid ) ) {
1688 continue;
1689 }
1690
1691 if( !get_fuel_available( bid ).empty() ) {
1692 use_bionic_by_id( bid );
1693 return true;
1694 } else {
1695 const std::function<bool( const item & )> fuel_filter = [bid]( const item & it ) {
1696 for( const itype_id &fid : bid->fuel_opts ) {
1697 return it.typeId() == fid || ( !it.is_container_empty() && it.contents.front().typeId() == fid );
1698 }
1699 return false;
1700 };
1701
1702 if( consume_cbm_items( fuel_filter ) ) {
1703 use_bionic_by_id( bid );
1704 return true;
1705 } else {
1706 const std::vector<itype_id> fuel_op = bid->fuel_opts;
1707 const bool need_alcohol =
1708 std::find( fuel_op.begin(), fuel_op.end(), itype_chem_ethanol ) !=
1709 fuel_op.end() ||
1710 std::find( fuel_op.begin(), fuel_op.end(), itype_chem_methanol ) !=
1711 fuel_op.end() ||
1712 std::find( fuel_op.begin(), fuel_op.end(), itype_denat_alcohol ) !=
1713 fuel_op.end();
1714
1715 if( std::find( fuel_op.begin(), fuel_op.end(), itype_battery ) != fuel_op.end() ) {
1716 complain_about( "need_batteries", 3_hours, "<need_batteries>", false );
1717 } else if( need_alcohol ) {
1718 complain_about( "need_booze", 3_hours, "<need_booze>", false );
1719 } else {
1720 complain_about( "need_fuel", 3_hours, "<need_fuel>", false );
1721 }
1722 }
1723 }
1724 }
1725
1726 if( use_bionic_by_id( bio_furnace ) ) {
1727 const std::function<bool( const item & )> furnace_filter = []( const item & it ) {
1728 return it.typeId() == itype_id( "withered" ) || it.typeId() == itype_id( "file" ) ||
1729 it.has_flag( "FIREWOOD" );
1730 };
1731 if( consume_cbm_items( furnace_filter ) ) {
1732 return true;
1733 } else {
1734 complain_about( "need_junk", 3_hours, "<need_junk>", false );
1735 }
1736 }
1737
1738 if( use_bionic_by_id( bio_reactor ) || use_bionic_by_id( bio_advreactor ) ) {
1739 const std::function<bool( const item & )> reactor_filter = []( const item & it ) {
1740 return it.is_ammo() && ( it.ammo_type() == ammo_plutonium ||
1741 it.ammo_type() == ammo_reactor_slurry );
1742 };
1743 if( consume_cbm_items( reactor_filter ) ) {
1744 return true;
1745 } else {
1746 complain_about( "need_radioactives", 3_hours, "<need_radioactives>", false );
1747 }
1748 }
1749
1750 return false;
1751}

◆ regen_ai_cache()

void npc::regen_ai_cache ( )

662{
663 map &here = get_map();

665 while( i != std::end( ai_cache.sound_alerts ) ) {
666 if( sees( here.getlocal( i->abs_pos ) ) ) {

669 path.clear();

672 ++i;

675 float old_assessment = ai_cache.danger_assessment;

677 ai_cache.target = shared_ptr_fast<Creature>();
678 ai_cache.ally = shared_ptr_fast<Creature>();
679 ai_cache.can_heal.clear_all();

682 ai_cache.my_weapon_value = weapon_value( weapon );

685 assess_danger();
686 if( old_assessment > NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW && ai_cache.danger_assessment <= 0 ) {
687 warn_about( "relax", 30_minutes );
688 } else if( old_assessment <= 0.0f && ai_cache.danger_assessment > NPC_DANGER_VERY_LOW ) {
689 warn_about( "general_danger" );
690 }
691 // Non-allied NPCs with a completed mission should move to the player
692 if( !is_player_ally() && !is_stationary( true ) ) {
693 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
694 for( auto &miss : chatbin.missions_assigned ) {
695 if( miss->is_complete( getID() ) ) {
696 // unless the player found an item and already told the NPC he wanted to keep it
697 const mission_goal &mgoal = miss->get_type().goal;
698 if( ( mgoal == MGOAL_FIND_ITEM || mgoal == MGOAL_FIND_ANY_ITEM ||
699 mgoal == MGOAL_FIND_ITEM_GROUP ) &&
700 has_effect( effect_npc_player_looking ) ) {
701 continue;
702 }
703 if( global_omt_location() != player_character.global_omt_location() ) {
704 goal = player_character.global_omt_location();
705 }
706 set_attitude( NPCATT_TALK );
707 break;
708 }
709 }
710 }

3145{
3146 if( new_attitude == attitude ) {
3147 return;
3148 }
3149 previous_attitude = attitude;

3151 new_attitude = NPCATT_FLEE_TEMP;
3152 }

3158 name, npc_attitude_id( attitude ), npc_attitude_id( new_attitude ) );
3159 attitude_group new_group = get_attitude_group( new_attitude );
3160 attitude_group old_group = get_attitude_group( attitude );
3161 if( new_group != old_group && !is_fake() && g->u.sees( *this ) ) {
3162 switch( new_group ) {
3163 case attitude_group::hostile:
3164 add_msg_if_npc( m_bad, _( "<npcname> gets angry!" ) );
3165 break;
3166 case attitude_group::fearful:
3167 add_msg_if_npc( m_warning, _( "<npcname> gets scared!" ) );
3168 break;
3169 default:
3170 if( old_group == attitude_group::hostile ) {
3171 add_msg_if_npc( m_good, _( "<npcname> calms down." ) );
3172 } else if( old_group == attitude_group::fearful ) {
3173 add_msg_if_npc( _( "<npcname> is no longer afraid." ) );
3174 }
3175 break;
3176 }
3177 }
3178 attitude = new_attitude;

◆ set_omt_destination()

void npc::set_omt_destination ( )

Definition at line 4113 of file npcmove.cpp.

4114{
4115 /* TODO: Make NPCs' movement more intelligent.
4116 * Right now this function just makes them attempt to address their needs:
4117 * if we need ammo, go to a gun store, if we need food, go to a grocery store,
4118 * and if we don't have any needs, pick a random spot.
4119 * What it SHOULD do is that, if there's time; but also look at our mission and
4120 * our faction to determine more meaningful actions, such as attacking a rival
4121 * faction's base, or meeting up with someone friendly. NPCs should also
4122 * attempt to reach safety before nightfall, and possibly similar goals.
4123 * Also, NPCs should be able to assign themselves missions like "break into that
4124 * lab" or "map that river bank."
4125 */
4126 if( is_stationary( true ) ) {
4127 guard_current_pos();
4128 return;
4129 }
4130
4131 // all of the following luxuries are at ground level.
4132 // so please wallow in hunger & fear if below ground.
4133 if( posz() != 0 && !get_map().has_zlevels() ) {
4134 goal = no_goal_point;
4135 return;
4136 }
4137
4138 tripoint_abs_omt surface_omt_loc = global_omt_location();
4139 // We need that, otherwise find_closest won't work properly
4140 surface_omt_loc.z() = 0;
4141
4142 // also, don't bother looking if the CITY_SIZE is 0, just go somewhere at random
4143 const int city_size = get_option<int>( "CITY_SIZE" );
4144 if( city_size == 0 ) {
4145 goal = surface_omt_loc + point( rng( -90, 90 ), rng( -90, 90 ) );
4146 return;
4147 }
4148
4149 decide_needs();
4150 if( needs.empty() ) { // We don't need anything in particular.
4151 needs.push_back( need_none );
4152 }
4153
4154 std::string dest_type;
4155 for( const auto &fulfill : needs ) {
4156 // look for the closest occurence of any of that locations terrain types
4157 std::vector<oter_type_id> loc_list = get_location_for( fulfill )->get_all_terrains();
4158 std::shuffle( loc_list.begin(), loc_list.end(), rng_get_engine() );
4159 omt_find_params find_params;
4160 std::vector<std::pair<std::string, ot_match_type>> temp_types;
4161 for( const oter_type_id &elem : loc_list ) {
4162 std::pair<std::string, ot_match_type> temp_pair;
4163 temp_pair.first = elem.id().str();
4164 temp_pair.second = ot_match_type::type;
4165 temp_types.push_back( temp_pair );
4166 }
4167 find_params.search_range = 75;
4168 find_params.min_distance = 0;
4169 find_params.must_see = false;
4170 find_params.cant_see = false;
4171 find_params.types = temp_types;
4172 find_params.existing_only = false;
4173 goal = overmap_buffer.find_closest( surface_omt_loc, find_params );
4174 omt_path.clear();
4175 if( goal != overmap::invalid_tripoint ) {
4176 omt_path = overmap_buffer.get_travel_path( surface_omt_loc, goal, overmap_path_params::for_npc() );
4177 }
4178 if( !omt_path.empty() ) {
4179 break;
4180 }
4181 }
4182
4183 // couldn't find any places to go, so go somewhere.
4184 if( goal == overmap::invalid_tripoint || omt_path.empty() ) {
4185 goal = surface_omt_loc + point( rng( -90, 90 ), rng( -90, 90 ) );
4186 omt_path = overmap_buffer.get_travel_path( surface_omt_loc, goal, overmap_path_params::for_npc() );
4187 // try one more time
4188 if( omt_path.empty() ) {
4189 goal = surface_omt_loc + point( rng( -90, 90 ), rng( -90, 90 ) );
4190 omt_path = overmap_buffer.get_travel_path( surface_omt_loc, goal, overmap_path_params::for_npc() );
4191 }
4192 if( omt_path.empty() ) {
4193 goal = no_goal_point;
4194 }
4195 return;
4196 }
4197
4198 DebugLog( DL::Info, DC::Main ) << "npc::set_omt_destination - new goal for NPC [" << get_name()
4199 << "] with [" << get_need_str_id( needs.front() )
4200 << "] is [" << dest_type << "] in " << goal.to_string() << ".";
4201}
npc::get_need_str_id
static std::string get_need_str_id(const npc_need &need)
Definition: npc.cpp:2868
npc::guard_current_pos
void guard_current_pos()
Definition: npcmove.cpp:4272

Definition: npc.cpp:2873

◆ setpos()

void npc::setpos ( const tripoint &  pos)
overridevirtual

Note: this places NPC on a given position in CURRENT MAP coordinates.

Do not use when placing a NPC in mapgen.

Reimplemented from Character.

Definition at line 681 of file npc.cpp.

682{
683 position = pos;
684 const point_abs_om pos_om_old( sm_to_om_copy( submap_coords ) );
685 submap_coords.x = g->get_levx() + pos.x / SEEX;
686 submap_coords.y = g->get_levy() + pos.y / SEEY;
687 // TODO: fix point types
688 const point_abs_om pos_om_new( sm_to_om_copy( submap_coords ) );
689 if( !is_fake() && pos_om_old != pos_om_new ) {
690 overmap &om_old = overmap_buffer.get( pos_om_old );
691 overmap &om_new = overmap_buffer.get( pos_om_new );
692 if( const auto ptr = om_old.erase_npc( getID() ) ) {
693 om_new.insert_npc( ptr );
694 } else {
695 // Don't move the npc pointer around to avoid having two overmaps
696 // with the same npc pointer
697 debugmsg( "could not find npc %s on its old overmap", name );
698 }
699 }
700}

1695 ret.push_back( my_currency );
1696 }

1698 }

1700
1701 int count = 0;
1702 bool last_item = false;
1703 while( shop_value > 0 && total_space > 0_ml && !last_item ) {
1704 item tmpit = item_group::item_from( from, calendar::turn );
1705 if( !tmpit.is_null() && total_space >= tmpit.volume() ) {
1706 tmpit.set_owner( *this );
1707 ret.push_back( tmpit );
1708 shop_value -= tmpit.price( true );
1709 total_space -= tmpit.volume();
1710 count += 1;
1711 last_item = count > 10 && one_in( 100 );
1712 }
1713 }
1714
1715 has_new_items = true;
1716 inv.clear();
1717 inv.push_back( ret );

813 if( !best || best == skill_stabbing ) {

815 } else if( best == skill_bashing ) {

◆ talk_to_u()

void npc::talk_to_u ( bool  radio_contact = false)

Definition at line 731 of file npctalk.cpp.

732{
733 if( g->u.is_dead_state() ) {
734 set_attitude( NPCATT_NULL );
735 return;
736 }
737 const bool has_mind_control = g->u.has_trait( trait_DEBUG_MIND_CONTROL );
738 // This is necessary so that we don't bug the player over and over
739 if( get_attitude() == NPCATT_TALK ) {
740 set_attitude( NPCATT_NULL );
741 } else if( !has_mind_control && ( get_attitude() == NPCATT_FLEE ||
742 get_attitude() == NPCATT_FLEE_TEMP ) ) {
743 add_msg( _( "%s is fleeing from you!" ), name );
744 return;
745 } else if( !has_mind_control && get_attitude() == NPCATT_KILL ) {
746 add_msg( _( "%s is hostile!" ), name );
747 return;
748 }
749 if( get_faction() ) {
750 get_faction()->known_by_u = true;
751 }
752 set_known_to_u( true );
753 dialogue d;
754 d.alpha = &g->u;
755 d.beta = this;
756
757 chatbin.check_missions();
758
759 // For each active mission we have, let the mission know we talked to this NPC.
760 for( auto &mission : g->u.get_active_missions() ) {
761 mission->on_talk_with_npc( this->getID() );
762 }
763
764 for( auto &mission : chatbin.missions_assigned ) {
765 if( mission->get_assigned_player_id() == g->u.getID() ) {
766 d.missions_assigned.push_back( mission );
767 }
768 }
769 d.add_topic( chatbin.first_topic );
770 if( radio_contact ) {
771 d.add_topic( "TALK_RADIO" );
772 d.by_radio = true;
773 } else if( is_leader() ) {
774 d.add_topic( "TALK_LEADER" );
775 } else if( is_player_ally() && ( is_walking_with() || has_activity() ) ) {
776 d.add_topic( "TALK_FRIEND" );
777 } else if( get_attitude() == NPCATT_RECOVER_GOODS ) {
778 d.add_topic( "TALK_STOLE_ITEM" );
779 }
780 g->u.dialogue_by_radio = d.by_radio;
781 int most_difficult_mission = 0;
782 for( auto &mission : chatbin.missions ) {
783 const auto &type = mission->get_type();
784 if( type.urgent && type.difficulty > most_difficult_mission ) {
785 d.add_topic( "TALK_MISSION_DESCRIBE_URGENT" );
786 chatbin.mission_selected = mission;
787 most_difficult_mission = type.difficulty;
788 }
789 }
790 most_difficult_mission = 0;
791 bool chosen_urgent = false;
792 for( auto &mission : chatbin.missions_assigned ) {
793 if( mission->get_assigned_player_id() != g->u.getID() ) {
794 // Not assigned to the player that is currently talking to the npc
795 continue;
796 }
797 const auto &type = mission->get_type();
798 if( ( type.urgent && !chosen_urgent ) || ( type.difficulty > most_difficult_mission &&
799 ( type.urgent || !chosen_urgent ) ) ) {
800 chosen_urgent = type.urgent;
801 d.add_topic( "TALK_MISSION_INQUIRE" );
802 chatbin.mission_selected = mission;
803 most_difficult_mission = type.difficulty;
804 }
805 }
806
807 // Needs
808 if( has_effect( effect_npc_suspend ) ) {
809 d.add_topic( "TALK_REBOOT" );
810 }
811 if( has_effect( effect_sleep ) || has_effect( effect_lying_down ) ) {
812 if( has_effect( effect_narcosis ) ) {
813 d.add_topic( "TALK_SEDATED" );
814 } else {
815 d.add_topic( "TALK_WAKE_UP" );
816 }
817 }
818
819 if( d.topic_stack.back().id == "TALK_NONE" ) {
820 d.topic_stack.back() = talk_topic( pick_talk_topic( g->u ) );
821 }
822
823 moves -= 100;
824
825 if( g->u.is_deaf() ) {
826 if( d.topic_stack.back().id == "TALK_MUG" ||
827 d.topic_stack.back().id == "TALK_STRANGER_AGGRESSIVE" ) {
828 make_angry();
829 d.add_topic( "TALK_DEAF_ANGRY" );
830 } else {
831 d.add_topic( "TALK_DEAF" );
832 }
833 }
834
835 if( g->u.has_trait( trait_PROF_FOODP ) && !( g->u.is_wearing( itype_id( "foodperson_mask" ) ) ||
836 g->u.is_wearing( itype_id( "foodperson_mask_on" ) ) ) ) {
837 d.add_topic( "TALK_NOFACE" );
838 }
839
840 if( has_trait( trait_PROF_FOODP ) && !( is_wearing( itype_id( "foodperson_mask" ) ) ||
841 is_wearing( itype_id( "foodperson_mask_on" ) ) ) ) {
842 d.add_topic( "TALK_NPC_NOFACE" );
843 }
844
845 decide_needs();
846
847 dialogue_window d_win;
848 // Main dialogue loop
849 do {
850 if( chatbin.mission_selected != nullptr ) {
851 if( chatbin.mission_selected->get_assigned_player_id() != g->u.getID() ) {
852 // Don't talk about a mission that is assigned to someone else.
853 chatbin.mission_selected = nullptr;
854 }
855 }
856 if( chatbin.mission_selected == nullptr ) {
857 // if possible, select a mission to talk about
858 if( !chatbin.missions.empty() ) {
859 chatbin.mission_selected = chatbin.missions.front();
860 } else if( !d.missions_assigned.empty() ) {
861 chatbin.mission_selected = d.missions_assigned.front();
862 }
863 }
864 const talk_topic next = d.opt( d_win, name, d.topic_stack.back() );
865 if( next.id == "TALK_NONE" ) {
866 int cat = topic_category( d.topic_stack.back() );
867 do {
868 d.topic_stack.pop_back();
869 } while( cat != -1 && topic_category( d.topic_stack.back() ) == cat );
870 }
871 if( next.id == "TALK_DONE" || d.topic_stack.empty() ) {
872 d.beta->say( _( "Bye." ) );
873 d.done = true;
874 } else if( next.id != "TALK_NONE" ) {
875 d.add_topic( next );
876 }
877 } while( !d.done );
878
879 if( g->u.activity.id() == ACT_AIM && !g->u.has_weapon() ) {
880 g->u.cancel_activity();
881 // don't query certain activities that are started from dialogue
882 } else if( g->u.activity.id() == ACT_TRAIN ||
883 g->u.activity.id() == ACT_WAIT_NPC ||
884 g->u.activity.id() == ACT_SOCIALIZE ||
885 g->u.activity.index == getID().get_value() ) {
886 return;
887 }
888
889 if( !g->u.has_effect( effect_under_op ) ) {
890 g->cancel_activity_or_ignore_query( distraction_type::talked_to,
891 string_format( _( "%s talked to you." ), name ) );
892 }
893}
Character::is_wearing
bool is_wearing(const item &itm) const
Returns true if the player is wearing the item.

877{
878 const auto &type = book.type->book;
879 const skill_id &skill = type->skill;
880 // The reader's reading speed has an effect only if they're trying to understand the book as they read it
881 // Reading speed is assumed to be how well you learn from books (as opposed to hands-on experience)
882 const bool try_understand = character_funcs::is_fun_to_read( reader, book ) ||
883 reader.get_skill_level( skill ) < type->level;
884 int reading_speed = try_understand ? std::max( reader.read_speed(), read_speed() ) : read_speed();
885
886 int retval = type->time * reading_speed;
887 retval *= std::min(
888 character_funcs::fine_detail_vision_mod( *this ),
889 character_funcs::fine_detail_vision_mod( reader )
890 );
891
892 if( type->intel > reader.get_int() && !reader.has_trait( trait_PROF_DICEMASTER ) ) {
893 retval += type->time * ( type->intel - reader.get_int() ) * 100;
894 }
895 return retval;
896}

bool npc::update_path ( const tripoint &  p,
bool  no_bashing = false,
bool  force = true 
)

Tries to find path to p.

If it can, updates path to it.

Parameters
pDestination of pathing
no_bashingDon't allow pathing through tiles that require bashing.
forceIf there is no valid path, empty the current path.
Returns
If it updated the path.

2170{
2171 if( p == pos() ) {
2172 path.clear();
2173 return true;
2174 }
2175

2177 path.erase( path.begin() );
2178 }
2179
2180 if( !path.empty() ) {
2181 const tripoint &last = path[path.size() - 1];
2182 if( last == p && ( path[0].z != posz() || rl_dist( path[0], pos() ) <= 1 ) ) {
2183 // Our path already leads to that point, no need to recalculate
2184 return true;
2185 }
2186 }
2187

2189 get_path_avoid() );

int npc::value ( const item &  it,

) const

Definition at line 1744 of file npc.cpp.

1745{
1746 if( it.is_dangerous() || ( it.has_flag( "BOMB" ) && it.active ) || it.made_of( LIQUID ) ) {
1747 // NPCs won't be interested in buying active explosives or spilled liquids
1748 return -1000;
1749 }
1750
1751 // faction currency trades at market price
1752 if( my_fac && my_fac->currency == it.typeId() ) {
1753 return market_price;
1754 }
1755
1756 int ret = 0;
1757 // TODO: Cache own weapon value (it can be a bit expensive to compute 50 times/turn)
1758 double weapon_val = weapon_value( it ) - weapon_value( weapon );
1759 if( weapon_val > 0 ) {
1760 ret += weapon_val;
1761 }
1762
1763 if( it.is_food() ) {
1764 int comestval = 0;
1765 if( nutrition_for( it ) > 0 || it.get_comestible()->quench > 0 ) {
1766 comestval++;
1767 }
1768 if( max_stored_kcal() - get_stored_kcal() > 500 ) {
1769 comestval += ( nutrition_for( it ) +
1770 ( max_stored_kcal() - get_stored_kcal() - 500 ) / 10 ) / 6;
1771 }
1772 if( get_thirst() > thirst_levels::thirsty ) {
1773 comestval += ( it.get_comestible()->quench + get_thirst() - thirst_levels::thirsty ) / 4;
1774 }
1775 if( comestval > 0 && will_eat( it ).success() ) {
1776 ret += comestval;
1777 }
1778 }
1779
1780 if( it.is_ammo() ) {
1781 if( weapon.is_gun() && weapon.ammo_types().count( it.ammo_type() ) ) {
1782 // TODO: magazines - don't count ammo as usable if the weapon isn't.
1783 ret += 14;
1784 }
1785
1786 if( has_gun_for_ammo( it.ammo_type() ) ) {
1787 // TODO: consider making this cumulative (once was)
1788 ret += 14;
1789 }
1790 }
1791
1792 if( it.is_book() ) {
1793 auto &book = *it.type->book;
1794 ret += book.fun;
1795 if( book.skill && get_skill_level( book.skill ) < book.level &&
1796 get_skill_level( book.skill ) >= book.req ) {
1797 ret += book.level * 3;
1798 }
1799 }
1800
1801 // Practical item value is more important than price
1802 ret *= 50;
1803
1804 // TODO: Sometimes we want more than one tool? Also we don't want EVERY tool.
1805 if( it.is_tool() && !has_amount( it.typeId(), 1 ) ) {
1806 ret += market_price * 0.2; // 20% premium for fresh tools
1807 }
1808 ret += market_price;
1809 return ret;
1810}

◆ vehicle_danger()

float npc::vehicle_danger ( int  radius) const

Definition at line 1373 of file npc.cpp.

1374{
1375 const tripoint from( posx() - radius, posy() - radius, posz() );
1376 const tripoint to( posx() + radius, posy() + radius, posz() );
1377 VehicleList vehicles = g->m.get_vehicles( from, to );
1378
1379 int danger = 0;
1380
1381 // TODO: check for most dangerous vehicle?
1382 for( size_t i = 0; i < vehicles.size(); ++i ) {
1383 const wrapped_vehicle &wrapped_veh = vehicles[i];
1384 if( wrapped_veh.v->is_moving() ) {
1385 // FIXME: this can't be the right way to do this
1386 units::angle facing = wrapped_veh.v->face.dir();
1387
1388 point a( wrapped_veh.v->global_pos3().xy() );
1389 point b( static_cast<int>( a.x + units::cos( facing ) * radius ),
1390 static_cast<int>( a.y + units::sin( facing ) * radius ) );
1391
1392 // fake size
1393 /* This will almost certainly give the wrong size/location on customized
1394 * vehicles. This should just count frames instead. Or actually find the
1395 * size. */
1396 vehicle_part last_part;
1397 // vehicle_part_range is a forward only iterator, see comment in vpart_range.h
1398 for( const vpart_reference &vpr : wrapped_veh.v->get_all_parts() ) {
1399 last_part = vpr.part();
1400 }
1401 int size = std::max( last_part.mount.x, last_part.mount.y );
1402
1403 double normal = std::sqrt( static_cast<float>( ( b.x - a.x ) * ( b.x - a.x ) + ( b.y - a.y ) *
1404 ( b.y - a.y ) ) );
1405 int closest = static_cast<int>( std::abs( ( posx() - a.x ) * ( b.y - a.y ) - ( posy() - a.y ) *
1406 ( b.x - a.x ) ) / normal );
1407
1408 if( size > closest ) {
1409 danger = i;
1410 }
1411 }
1412 }
1413 return danger;
1414}

1099 }

1104 reason = _( "I tried but couldn't wear it." );

1106 }
1107 }
1108 reason = _( "Thanks, I'll wear that now." );

bool npc::wield ( item &  target)
overridevirtual

Removes currently wielded item (if any) and replaces it with the target item.

Parameters
targetreplacement item to wield or null item to remove existing weapon without replacing it
Returns
whether both removal and replacement were successful (they are performed atomically)

◆ wield_better_weapon()

bool npc::wield_better_weapon ( )

Definition at line 3403 of file npcmove.cpp.

3404{
3405 // TODO: Allow wielding weaker weapons against weaker targets
3406 bool can_use_gun = ( !is_player_ally() || rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_guns ) );
3407 bool use_silent = ( is_player_ally() && rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_silent ) );

3409
3410 // Check if there's something better to wield
3411 item *best = &weapon;
3412 double best_value = -100.0;
3413
3414 const int ups_charges = charges_of( itype_UPS );
3415
3416 const auto compare_weapon =
3417 [this, &best, &best_value, ups_charges, can_use_gun, use_silent]( const item & it ) {
3418 bool allowed = can_use_gun && it.is_gun() && ( !use_silent || it.is_silent() );
3419 double val;
3420 if( !allowed ) {
3421 val = weapon_value( it, 0 );
3422 } else {
3423 int ammo_count = it.ammo_remaining();
3424 int ups_drain = it.get_gun_ups_drain();
3425 if( ups_drain > 0 ) {
3426 ammo_count = std::min( ammo_count, ups_charges / ups_drain );
3427 }
3428
3429 val = weapon_value( it, ammo_count );
3430 }
3431
3432 if( val > best_value ) {
3433 best = const_cast<item *>( &it );
3434 best_value = val;
3435 }
3436 };
3437
3438 compare_weapon( weapon );
3439 // To prevent changing to barely better stuff
3440 best_value *= std::max<float>( 1.0f, ai_cache.danger_assessment / 10.0f );
3441
3442 // Fists aren't checked below
3443 compare_weapon( null_item_reference() );
3444
3445 visit_items( [&compare_weapon, this]( item * node ) {
3446 // Only compare melee weapons, guns, or holstered items
3447 if( node->is_melee() || node->is_gun() ) {
3448 compare_weapon( *node );
3449 } else if( node->get_use( "holster" ) && !node->contents.empty() && node != &weapon ) {
3450 // TODO: special case for "wield from wielded holster"
3451 const item &holstered = node->get_contained();
3452 if( holstered.is_melee() || holstered.is_gun() ) {
3453 compare_weapon( holstered );
3454 }
3455 }
3456 return VisitResponse::SKIP;
3457 } );
3458
3459 // TODO: Reimplement switching to empty guns
3460 // Needs to check reload speed, RELOAD_ONE etc.
3461 // Until then, the NPCs should reload the guns as a last resort
3462
3463 if( best == &weapon ) {
3464 add_msg( m_debug, "Wielded %s is best at %.1f, not switching", best->type->get_id().str(),
3465 best_value );
3466 return false;
3467 }
3468
3469 add_msg( m_debug, "Wielding %s at value %.1f", best->type->get_id().str(), best_value );
3470
3471 wield( *best );
3472 return true;
3473}

◆ wont_hit_friend()

bool npc::wont_hit_friend ( const tripoint &  tar,

Definition at line 2082 of file npcmove.cpp.

2083{
2084 // TODO: Get actual dispersion instead of extracting it (badly) from confident range
2085 int confident = throwing ?
2086 confident_throw_range( it, nullptr ) :
2087 confident_shoot_range( it, recoil_total() );
2088 // if there is no confidence at using weapon, it's not used at range
2089 // zero confidence leads to divide by zero otherwise
2090 if( confident < 1 ) {
2091 return true;
2092 }
2093
2094 if( rl_dist( pos(), tar ) == 1 ) {
2095 return true; // If we're *really* sure that our aim is dead-on
2096 }
2097
2098 units::angle target_angle = coord_to_angle( pos(), tar );
2099
2100 // TODO: Base on dispersion
2101 units::angle safe_angle = 30_degrees;
2102
2103 for( const auto &fr : ai_cache.friends ) {
2104 const shared_ptr_fast<Creature> ally_p = fr.lock();
2105 if( !ally_p ) {
2106 continue;
2107 }
2108 const Creature &ally = *ally_p;
2109
2110 // TODO: Extract common functions with turret target selection
2111 units::angle safe_angle_ally = safe_angle;
2112 int ally_dist = rl_dist( pos(), ally.pos() );
2113 if( ally_dist < 3 ) {
2114 safe_angle_ally += ( 3 - ally_dist ) * 30_degrees;
2115 }
2116
2117 units::angle ally_angle = coord_to_angle( pos(), ally.pos() );
2118 units::angle angle_diff = units::fabs( ally_angle - target_angle );
2119 angle_diff = std::min( 360_degrees - angle_diff, angle_diff );
2120 if( angle_diff < safe_angle_ally ) {
2121 // TODO: Disable NPC whining is it's other NPC who prevents aiming
2122 return false;
2123 }
2124 }
2125
2126 return true;
2127}

void npc::worker_downtime ( )

2593{
2594 map &here = get_map();
2595 // are we already in a chair
2596 if( here.has_flag_furn( "CAN_SIT", pos() ) ) {
2597 // just chill here
2598 move_pause();
2599 return;
2600 }
2601 // already know of a chair, go there
2602 if( chair_pos != tripoint_min ) {
2603 if( here.has_flag_furn( "CAN_SIT", here.getlocal( chair_pos ) ) ) {
2604 update_path( here.getlocal( chair_pos ) );
2605 if( pos() == here.getlocal( chair_pos ) || path.empty() ) {
2606 move_pause();
2607 path.clear();
2608 } else {
2609 move_to_next();
2610 }
2611 wander_pos = tripoint_min;
2612 return;
2613 } else {
2614 chair_pos = tripoint_min;
2615 }
2616 } else {
2617 // find a chair
2618 if( !is_mounted() ) {
2619 for( const tripoint &elem : here.points_in_radius( pos(), 30 ) ) {
2620 if( here.has_flag_furn( "CAN_SIT", elem ) && !g->critter_at( elem ) && could_move_onto( elem ) &&
2621 here.point_within_camp( here.getabs( elem ) ) ) {
2622 // this one will do
2623 chair_pos = here.getabs( elem );
2624 return;
2625 }
2626 }
2627 }
2628 }
2629 // we got here if there are no chairs available.
2630 // wander back to near the bulletin board of the camp.
2631 if( wander_pos != tripoint_min ) {
2632 update_path( here.getlocal( wander_pos ) );
2633 if( pos() == here.getlocal( wander_pos ) || path.empty() ) {
2634 move_pause();
2635 path.clear();
2636 if( one_in( 30 ) ) {
2637 wander_pos = tripoint_min;
2638 }
2639 } else {
2640 move_to_next();
2641 }
2642 return;
2643 }
2644 if( assigned_camp ) {
2645 cata::optional<basecamp *> bcp = overmap_buffer.find_camp( ( *assigned_camp ).xy() );
2646 if( !bcp ) {
2647 assigned_camp = cata::nullopt;
2648 move_pause();
2649 return;
2650 }
2651 basecamp *temp_camp = *bcp;
2652 std::vector<tripoint> pts;
2653 for( const tripoint &elem : here.points_in_radius( here.getlocal( temp_camp->get_bb_pos() ),
2654 10 ) ) {
2655 if( g->critter_at( elem ) || !could_move_onto( elem ) || here.has_flag( TFLAG_DEEP_WATER, elem ) ||
2656 !here.has_floor( elem ) || g->is_dangerous_tile( elem ) ) {
2657 continue;
2658 }
2659 pts.push_back( elem );
2660 }
2661 if( !pts.empty() ) {
2662 wander_pos = here.getabs( random_entry( pts ) );
2663 return;
2664 }
2665 }
2666 move_pause();
2667}

◆ submap_coords

point npc::submap_coords
private

Global submap coordinates of the submap containing the npc.

Use global_*_location to get the global position. You should not change submap_coords directly, use pos instead, shift will update submap_coords and move the npc to a different overmap if needed. submap_coords defines the overmap the npc is stored on.

Definition at line 1269 of file npc.h.

Referenced by global_square_location(), npc(), place_on_map(), setpos(), spawn_at_precise(), and travel_overmap().
